title: Scroll position is lost when navigating back to Newsfeed / Discovery feed (Android)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

On the Android app, the user loses previous scroll position when navigating from (e.g.) Newsfeed > Notifications > Newsfeed. 

This was reported by a user, and I independently verified.

[User report](https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1359129081672634373)

### Steps to reproduce

- Launch the Minds app, logged in
- Navigate to the Newsfeed. Scroll down.
- Navigate to the Notifications screen.
- Navigate back to the Newsfeed.

### Platform information 

I tested on a Sony Xperia 10, Android 10, with the latest build from the Play Store.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- When returning to the Newsfeed, your previous scroll position is lost -- you will see the top of the Newsfeed.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- When returning to the Newsfeed, your previous scroll position should be remembered -- you can continue scrolling the feed where you left off.

title: Let users hide channel recommendations from the Newsfeed
description:
Our new in-feed channel recommendations is showing positive results for driving new channel subscriptions. Some users, however, have expressed wanting the ability to remove it.

We should add the option for users to temporarily hide in-feed channel recommendations from the Newsfeed.

## Acceptance

- [ ] When a user encounters in-feed channel recommendations on the Newsfeed, they have an interface that lets them choose to hide the component.
- [ ] If the user chooses to hide the component, the component disappears from the screen.
- [ ] Every time the user visits the Newsfeed, the in-feed channel recommendations component does not appear.
- [ ] If the user chooses to hide in-feed channel recommendations on the Newsfeed, this DOES NOT impact their appearance in other contexts such as when it appears after tapping the subscribe button.

## Design notes

**Designs to follow**

See same web task here -> https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/3030

- Designs -> https://www.figma.com/proto/iFtbrfoK1BUvybYMHgFHuX/Recommendations-%5BMobile%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=2%3A2&viewport=369%2C48%2C0.7&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=2%3A2

title: Define how to integrate codepush updates into our workflow & CI
description:
### Summary

We need to define how are we going to integrate the code push support into our work/deployment workflow.

- [ ] When a new release should be submitted to the app stores
- [ ] When a new build should be submitted to come-push 
- [ ] How we can use the Staging env to improve our mobile QA flow
- [ ] CI integration

title: Mobile should support new friendly captcha
description:
## Goal

Following frontend/backend implementation (https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/merge_requests/1851) of Friendly Captcha, mobile needs to also support

## What needs to be done

Implement the Friendly Captcha JS component under an experiment flag.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Implement using a feature flag
- [ ] Ensure any QA captcha overrides are still working

title: Channel Bio is not saved when added via Setup Channel
description:
### Summary

Channel Bio is not getting saved via Setup Channel Onboarding Panel. 

### Steps to reproduce

2. Login successfully.
3. Navigate to earn tokens option.

5. Add Bio to Channel.
6. Hit Save.

8. Notice that the bio is not saved.

v4.23 - iPhone 11 Pro

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Bio should automatically get saved.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Refresh Discovery tab when tapping navigation button
description:
## Acceptance

- when the user taps the Discovery button in the navigation (Search icon),

----

This is a feature request to auto-refresh when tapped on Home Icon (Latest & Top posts), Discovery Icon and Minds+ feeds.

Adding @markryansallee and @msantang78 for more details.

title: Tapping on Revoke Boost button does not do anything and continues to display
description:
### Summary

Notice that when you have a boost and you tap on Revoke button, it does not do anything. It only updates when the page is refreshed. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds app.
2. Login to your profile. 
3. Create a post and boost it. 
4. Go to Settings -> Boost. 
5. Select that post and tap revoke. 
6. Nothing happens. Tap again revoke. Nothing happens. 

Post has been revoked but user doesnt know until the page is refreshed as the revoke button is still available. 

### Platform information 

v4.23 - iPhone 11 Pro

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Revoke button is still available and not removed after a successful revoke. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Revoke button should not be available anymore when post is already revoked. A toast message must display ideally to inform the user. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![RevokeButton](/uploads/cce70ce7635e172611ec7c00ef417dab/RevokeButton.mov)

description:

title: Add unverified email toaster
description:
### Summary

Some actions are not showing the proper message when the server responds with an unverified error
 - Comments
 - Subscribe

The composer is working properly, we should create a global handler for this error and always display the toaster

title: Prompt user to 'see latest posts' on the newsfeed (app)
description:
When a user is scrolling through their feed, it may be that new content is available. However, currently the app neither polls or notifies the user when there is new content to view.

Please see design here -> https://www.sketch.com/s/0c0b6cff-4a1a-4adf-8899-359668617f9d/a/d9eyv2

## Acceptance criteria

- Poll for content every 30 seconds if on a 'latest' feed
- Display the see latest content hover tag
- The api endpoint should use a _count query for efficiency
- Do not poll when the browser is inactive
- Introduce as an experiment with id `front-4089-polling`
- Use GTE>= last search query time
- Badge/ticket to read "See X new posts"
- In the context of newsfeed, ensure we don't scroll to the boost rotator, but below it

title: Video transcoding
description:
## Goal

This is related to #4124 and #4125 

In order to speed up the video upload, we should reduce the resolution locally before uploading it to the server.
This will not only reduce the upload time but also the transcoding time on the backend

https://github.com/tanersener/ffmpeg-kit seems to be the best alternative for this.


## What needs to be done

 - Install https://github.com/tanersener/ffmpeg-kit for both platforms
 - Implement video transcoding as a previous step of the upload
   - Transcode video to 1080p and only if the resolution is bigger than that

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design
-


## Personas

This will improve the UX while submitting videos to the platform, reducing the time to upload the videos to the server

## Experiments

-


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The videos must be transcoded to 1080p for videos with a higher resolution
- [ ] The videos must be uploaded if the resolution is lowe than 1080p

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Deep-link for comment reply push notification doesn't work
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

- Given I'm on a mobile device,
- and I have the mobile app installed,
- and I receive a push notification for a comment / reply,
- when I tap the push notification,
- then the Minds app launches,
- and I see the last screen I visited within the app.

### Steps to reproduce

Follow steps above.

### Platform information 

iOS 15.3.x, iPhone 12 Mini, latest Test Flight build

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

title: Un-joined Groups posts bleeding into feeds
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Some users have reported that they see posts from Groups they're not members of appearing in their Newsfeeds.

[First reported in a comment here](https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/2886#note_846543988).

### Steps to reproduce

- Create an image post in a group from the iOS app.

### Platform information 

- "Bleeding" posts created on iOS app
- Newsfeed with posts observed on web app

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- Posts appear in the Newsfeed from Groups that the user is not a member of

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- Posts from Groups the user is not a member of do not appear in Newsfeeds
- Posts from Groups the user IS a member of can appear in Newsfeeds (this is an ongoing experiment)

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Screenshot below is from `@bashynx`, who (at the time of this recording) subscribed to me (`@mellamomrs`) but was not a member of the Apertures Anonymous group.

![image](/uploads/bc2057b342d03cb86cbc6d7ead766427/image.png)

title: Clearing filter on posts in groups not available on iOS app
description:
Original report:

> Firstly thanks for the ability to filter posts in groups again. It’s much appreciated. 
> 
> I don’t see the option to remove the filter though on my iPhone 12 Pro running 15.3.1. It’s more of an issue because the filter is static. I like the static results while focus is in the group but I’d like to suggest a ‘remove filter’ option in the search box once applied. Also if you leave the group the filter should be wiped. The user could click the box and the option would be the default. That way the results could stay static plus the option to change filter or remove filter would always be present while not requiring any additional screen real estate.

The issue is that we are not clearing the filter when leaving the screen. 

### Test considerations

 - Open a group and search for something
 - Go back and open a different group
 - The search field shouldn't be open and it should be empty

Thanks
Fretz![EBA58B14-0A91-4F58-B41F-5DCE0FD67F3E](/uploads/eccda40fa489fb33a59b2debced328e6/EBA58B14-0A91-4F58-B41F-5DCE0FD67F3E.png)

title: Newsfeed keeps the TOP mode when switching users
description:
### Summary

When switching users the feed keeps the top/latest option, this is causing an issue due that the feature is behind an experiment. For instance: Having the Top feed activated in a user and switching to a user that has the FF in `false` will cause that user to only see the top feed contact and he will be unable to change to the latest feed. 

Also, one of the feeds are not reset when switching

### Steps to reproduce

- Activate TOP
- Switch to a user that has the FF in false
- You now are unable to change the feed to `latest`

description:
<!---
Please read this!

filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

This library appears to be a lot better than the current one we are using. https://notifee.app

title: Video uploads are slow / never complete
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When posting a video from the mobile app on a 5G connection, the upload never completes.

### Steps to reproduce

From the mobile app, post a video (either from the camera roll, or by recording a new video). Complete the post and hit the paper airplane icon to send the post.

### Platform information 

iPhone app, iPhone 12 Mini, iOS 15.3.1

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The app shows an animated loading indicator above the video in the post composer, and appears to indefinitely try to load the video. The upload never completes.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Either (a) the upload completes quickly, or (b) the loading indicator accurately reflects progress so that the user knows it's working. I can't tell if it's working and I'm too impatient, or if it just hangs.

### Next Steps
- try to upload same video on both web mobile and RN mobile app over 4/5G and measure the difference
-

title: Save video to user's device after recording
description:
When a user records a video in the app, we should save a copy of the video to the user's device before uploading it so that if the video upload fails, the video is not lost entirely.

- Save the video locally after the user confirms it

title: Video sleeps in the middle of a recording
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When recording a video in the mobile app, the device may go to sleep in the middle of recording.

### Steps to reproduce

Using the mobile app, launch the activity post composer and post a new video recording. Start recording and let the recording run for longer than the device's screen sleep timeout .

### Platform information 

iPhone app, iPhone 12 Mini, iOS 15.3.1

I believe Tanya also confirmed this behavior on Android.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

On iPhone:
- The screen goes to sleep and the user can't see what they're recording.

On Android:
- The screen goes to sleep and the recording is stopped.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The screen should not go to sleep while the app is recording.

### Possible fixes

Prevent the device from going to sleep while the camera is open.

title: Issue loading and displaying stories in the newsfeed
description:
This is an issue I've seen for some time already on iOS. It relates to the inconsistent fetching of stories in the newsfeed.

### Platform 

App 4.21.1 / iOS 15.1.1

### Background
This issue happens only when accessing the newsfeed after not having used in the app in some time.

* In this case, I viewed launched the app this morning, after not having used it in maybe 24 hrs.
* The stories are slow to load. Seeing pulsating circles for around 4-5 seconds
* After fetching has stopped, only the Minds account story is visible.
* If I then pull to fresh again, everything displays as usual.
* If I close the app, relaunch it afterwards, it functionals as normal. Seems to only happen after not having used the app in some time. Perhaps after cache has expired...

### Supporting screenshots

<details><summary>Launching app after having not used it in some time.</summary>
![IMG_1807](/uploads/a1c4b3297b37a92d38ed1d851075ffe2/IMG_1807.PNG)
![IMG_1808](/uploads/d1aa116a14930375184102e749c6696e/IMG_1808.PNG)
</details>

<details><summary>After pulling to refresh the feed</summary>
![IMG_1809](/uploads/777c54f78e0eb5d41bbbc2e84b213de5/IMG_1809.PNG)
</details>

### Prototypes
- Freshly subscribed channel -> https://www.figma.com/proto/iFtbrfoK1BUvybYMHgFHuX/Recommendations-%5BMobile%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=5%3A1128&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=5%3A1128&show-proto-sidebar=1

- Empty channel feed -> https://www.figma.com/proto/iFtbrfoK1BUvybYMHgFHuX/Recommendations-%5BMobile%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=113%3A898&viewport=241%2C48%2C1&scaling=scale-down&starting-point-node-id=113%3A898&show-proto-sidebar=1

The above two cases are the only current scenarios for in-channel, channel recommendations.

NSFW filter settings entry missing
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

No entry to configure visibility of NSFW posts. There is such an entry in the web interface and only there it can be configured.

### Steps to reproduce

Choose Settings from menu. There are entries for Email and Password, but nothing for NSFW filter. In the web interface these three settings are together on one page.

### Platform information

Android, Galaxy S8+, latest version.

### App version

3.5.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Users can't change NSFW visibility status from app.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Users can change NSFW visibility status from app.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(none)

### Possible fixes

None known.

title: (bug): Long Messages not being sent
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Long messages are not sent, and are lost unless you happen to select all and copy before trying to send.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Send a long message (a few paragraphs worth of text)
2. It should appear as if the message is sent.
3. Press the back button
4. Re-open the chat
5. Observe your message was not sent 

### Platform information

Replicated on Android but I'd imagine it would be universal.

### App version

v3.3.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Message appears to have sent until you leave and rejoin the chat.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The user should be made aware if the message is too long and it should not disappear from the input box after they are warned. Ideally there should be some indicator of how many characters over the limit they are so that they can make necessary amendments.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Base UI Typography components
description:
### Summary

Implement the base typography component following the design guidelines #3608 

I'm splitting each of the base components creation into three parts.

#### Creation
Creation of the base component initial version following what was done and agreed on the Icon one. This is composed of structure, design and single use.

#### Spread
Spread it throughout the current UI in order to understand how it can be best adapted for using in the legacy application, adapting the props and exposing the necessary component wrappers.

#### Performance
Analyze the component's performance on the benchmarking tool to understand if any additional tweaks could be made to improve it's render/update phase either through memoization or exposing new wrappers.

title: InAppBrowser: Add The Option To Change Default Browser
description:
Currently all links are using in-app browser. This opens SafariServices/AuthenticationServices on iOS and Chrome Custom Tabs on android. But we should also give users the option to use their own browsers.

**as a user I want to be able to use my own browser when viewing links**
- given I've clicked a link for the first time, a bottom sheet should be shown in which I can select whether I want to use the in-app browser or my own browser
  - I should see a hint that I can change this behavior later in settings
  - After selecting the option, links should always use my preference
- given I want to change the default behavior of external link openings, I should see an option in settings that allows me to change this settings
  - this option should be in ___ [TBD]

title: Video upload issues
description:
## Summary

When you capture a portrait video directly on the app, there are multiple issues.

1. Immediately after posting, the dimensions are wrong and the post says There was an error displaying the media. This is really bad UX and makes the user think something broke, as the video has an error message and does not play.

![IMG_7882](/uploads/6d6294ed10da1f202d64baddbee8baa6/IMG_7882.PNG)



2. After a few minutes, the error message goes away. However, the dimensions are still incorrect on the thumbnail, and when you play the video, it converts to portrait but is squashed into landscape dimensions.

![IMG_7883](/uploads/58a262c3b84a3f1fb14fa2ecdff6c496/IMG_7883.PNG)

title: Lost ability to @tag autocomplete
description:
Proposed Designs - WIP

* Compose screen -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/dl7Z4x2
* As the user enters the `@` symbol a list of channels is displays. Front load channels the user subscribes to.
  * User can close the channel overlay by tapping a channel from the list, or backspacing to remove the `@` symbol or creating a space after the channel they've typed.
  * https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/JnmDlM5
* As the user continues to type a channel, the suggested list adapts accordingly -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b0895a24-57a1-4e79-8e58-2aeb2a8cdb7e/a/1K8Zwqa

title: New subscriber push notification
description: When a channel receives a new subscriber, a push notification is sent through on mobile. However, tapping the push notification, on iOS at least, navigates the user to their own channel, and not the channel of their new subscriber. Upon tapping, the user should be navigated to the channel of the new subscriber.

title: Keyboard doesn't pop up on composer if it opens in text mode
description: The autofocus is not working if the composer is open in text mode.

title: In-App Browser
description:
Created from https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520

Add an in-app browser to open links inside the app and let the user stay in the app.

A promising library is [React Native In-App Browser](https://github.com/proyecto26/react-native-inappbrowser) as discussed with @msantang78. It uses Chrome Custom Tabs on Android & SafariServices/AuthenticationServices on iOS.

Notes:
- We need to be very careful here not to break deeplinking. Youtube links are our most popular rich embed, it would be a shame if they now open in a webapp vs the youtube app. https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520#note_662077947
- We need to test how the web app works on a webview, and to figure out how to "share" the session between the app and the webview. https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3520#note_658011264

title: Android app restarts if device is rotated
description:
### Summary

In order to support rotated videos and images I need to enable rotation support into the app (we currently have this limited at project level on android and ios to portrait), but because we are also limiting it with the navigator we can allow this and control it at screens level.

The problem is that currently the app is restarting each time the user rotate the device

### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

Android

title: Implement a new camera component with rn-vision-camera
description:
Implement a new camera package using react-native-vision-camera

- [x] Video and image capture
- [x] Zoom support
- [x] focus support
- [x] Improved UI

title: Draft: Newsfeed V2
description:
This issue was born out of a discussion with @msantang78 and me.

Includes some functionalities such as:

1. scroll position persistence. when app is closed and opened, the newsfeed scroll position and data is saved. This requires support for multidirectional pagination on the backend
2. ~~new post indication: newsfeed should keep itself up to date. When new posts are available for a feed, an indication could be shown on top that the user can click and scroll to top to load and see those new posts.~~ 
3. smooth scroll to top: when pressing home, the feed should smoothly scroll to top and then start reloading. If there are a lot of items on top, it could jump.

title: Fix iOS CI build error with the photo selector
description:
The image picker fails on iOS if the app is built on circle CI but not if I do it locally. The app is built correctly, the rest of the features are working, but the image picker just fails.

We are using crop picker package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-native-image-crop-picker

This is a report of the issue: https://gitlab.com/minds/qa/qa/-/issues/41

I already tried:
  - Updating RN to the latest version
  - Updating the package to the latest version
  - Changing circle ci to use the same Xcode version that I have locally
  - Changing circle ci to use the latest version of Xcode

title: Upvotes modal freezing problem and other ui issues
description:
1. upvotes modal freezes after being opened and after loading placeholders. This is because of an issues with list item keys. Seen on android.
2. cancel button should have more margin from the bottom of the screen
3. placeholders should show the same number of items as the initial count of the interactions. e.g. if there are 10 dislikes, only show 10 placeholders
4. modal content should be handled better. currently the modal opens and it's transparent, but in the next frame it will get a primary background
5. loading line placeholders should be roughly in the same position and size as their content
6. loadMore should show a loading indicator at the end of the list. This loading should not be visible if the list was already showing a refresh indicator

title: Search crashes if there's no connection (offline)
description: Disconnect internet -> Open app -> Tap search = crash

title: Add handle bar to all BottomSheets

as suggested by @michaelfbradley, we should add handle bars to bottomSheets to give a clue that the bottomsheet can be dismissed by a swipe down, and also adhere to ux guidelines.

![image](/uploads/b4b61439941f4c4d5a51823b03019f0b/image.png)

title: Revised Edit Channel screen
description:
As part of the improvements made to the channel screen by @manishoo - see below details on the revised channel settings / edit channel screen.

![edit-channel](/uploads/86506ed260d3fe5724b7bc2ed5cc7d86/edit-channel.mp4)

Notes:
- https://www.sketch.com/s/b7570ac0-3b2e-4a91-bca0-f9c5942fc89f/a/1KlGvwn
- Remove the 'Edit Channel' option from the ellipsis and simply include an edit button (where subscribe would other be displayed) https://www.sketch.com/s/b7570ac0-3b2e-4a91-bca0-f9c5942fc89f/a/Ax1wGJx
- This overlay screen is new functionality, and will be used again in the application.
- Animation duration of the overlay is 300ms (on entry and exit) - easing @ (0.25, 0.1, 0.25, 1.0)

title: Newsfeed: Extremely Tall Images
description:
an extremely tall image on the newsfeed makes it hard to navigate/scroll. This is handled well on the web by limiting the aspect ratio / height. but isn't quite handled on mobile. 

check https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1280202767507394570 on mobile for reference

title: Discovery improvements
description:
- [x] Add an animated transition when changing tabs
- [x] Remove unnecessary reloads when changing tabs
- [x] Do not show refresh indicator while loading
- [x] Add placeholders for the initial load

title: Use ChannelListItem in place of old DiscoveryUser
description:
in many places we're still using `DiscoveryUser` and `NewDiscoveryUser` components which are old and don't look good. We should instead replace them with ChannelListItem, or if they had some significantly different functionality, with another replacement (most likely ChannelListItem will be enough)

places that come to my mind:
- [ ] search
- [ ] subscribers/subscriptions list
- [ ] discovery

- get familiar with Detox
- set it up on local machine
- document any challenges
- perhaps add tests for profile tweaks?

title: Show cached posts in the portrait bar while fetching new from server
description:
The portrait feed will now load posts from 00:00 of two days ago to allow caching. The previous implementation was fetching posts from `now() - 2 days` causing a cache miss every time because the parameter was changing each second. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1369/diffs)

We want to show the cached posts while we are fetching the new ones from the server. We can't just use the fetchLocalThenRemote method directly because we are grouping and ordering the posts before displaying them.

title: Error loading next page of offline cache
description:
### Summary
When there is no connectivity the app shows the cached entities, and if you start scrolling until it has to load the next page you see an error and you have to press 'try again' in order to get the next entities.

There are also some visual issues with that error message layout and colors

This error is probably a regression caused by the implementation of the new API service

title: Implement multi-user support
description:
With the new storage changes, where the cache and the information are stored on a by-user basis, we should be able to implement the multiuser support.

 - [x] Change the session storage to support multiple users
 - [x] Implement the user selector and login with other user options
 - [x] Implement the user change logic 
  - Ensure to fire the logout event so all the previous user data is cleared from the stores
  - Maybe it would be good to show the splash screen for a moment while switching users to hide the re-render of the main screen


### Design assets and notes

- Click through: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/YGLZqee/play
- Revise nav drawer. Inclusion of switch profile icon: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/3OjO9GZ
- New switch channel screen: https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/7yJyvg2
- Switch channel action sheet (from ellipsis): https://www.sketch.com/s/d8dc6725-6ebb-4dcf-a558-958b8107779e/a/oYJMMPx

There will be dependancy to have a 'modalised' variation of the login and registration processes to allow the user to login/register without losing context. I will create a follow up task for login / registration and will reference here.

* Unseen notification count is to be displayed per channel
* Tapping on a channel will switch the user and navigate to the newsfeed of the respective channel. Would be good to throw a toast notification here. e.g. `Switched to @channelName`
* When tapping on the ellipsis icon, an action sheet is displayed. They may explicitly 'Switch channel' or 'Logout'. The switch channel menu option would not appear if the selected channel is active.
* Logging out from here would then bring the user to the next available channel. Where the user logs out of the the only available channel, the user would then be redirected to the home screen.


### Issues 
- [ ] https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3559

title: WIP: Compose UX
description:
The compose screen/feature is central to one of the two most important functionalities of the app: consumption and production.

But currently this feature is very basic.

WIP list:
- opening animation
- fast load and accessibility
- simple but rich UI
- is there a reason why the PHOTO type is selected by default on mobile compose? is there data to backup this assumption?
- is there data to backup the assumption that users will most likely use the front camera? because that is selected by default
- fast media uploads
- on lower-end devices, it takes some time for the camera module to load, and if the user wants to open the composer and post something quick, they'd have to unnecessary wait for the camera module to load and experience a small freeze
- Optimistic posting: after pressing send, the post gets added to the feed and the rest of the "loading"/"try again"/"failed to post" workflow will happen from the feed instead of the compose screen
- ...

title: Videos: Video should keep playing in the background when device is locked
description:
## Goal

Add the ability to keep playing the video while the app is in the background.

note: Youtube offers this only in premium

## What needs to be done

Change player default settings

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

none


## Personas

That will allow users to keep listening to a video while the app is in the background 

## Experiments

none


## Acceptance Criteria


- [ ] If the app is playing a video and is moved to the background it should keep playing

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Videos: Floating Video
description: the playing video should stay floating around inside the app. and ideally user should have the option to keep the video floating around even outside the app.

title: Videos: Prevent Sleep
description: the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing

title: Videos: Black Flash Before Load
Videos: UX
description:
* [ ] there's a black flash before a video is played which is clunky. especially in Stories (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3450)
* [ ] the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3451)
* [ ] BIG FEATURE the playing video should stay floating around when navigating minds (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3452)
* [ ] BIG FEATURE video may keep playing in the background when device is locked. this will make listening to long-form content (podcast, interview, event) far easier. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3453)

### Summary

I cannot navigate to Bills channel through an image with a tag that I found, by searching ottman in images.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Search '@ottman' in discovery images.
2. Click on a picture.
3. Click on one of Bills tags.

### Platform information

Android

rc1-v3.8.0

Error is shown

It should either navigate to the channel properly, or if it cannot, give a user friendly, ideally explanitory error.

![Wire_2019-07-06_at_7_42_PM](/uploads/24f27ea261aeb10a9e621c6c45e65435/Wire_2019-07-06_at_7_42_PM.jpeg)

Could be a bug in offline mode, not many results are showing up so the one I found may have been stored already, and the tag then could not be navigated to?

title: (Bug): it takes two taps on notifs if not direct on text
(feat): Global user mobile e2e
description:
In order for https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/issues/907 & https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/issues/903 to work correctly, they will need to share a common user, as messenger will need a fresh user so that the onboarding messenger password step is not skipped.

This user will have to be created by manually calling the create user endpoint, and then the users details can be assigned to global vars to be used in any needed tests. Doing this means that the _login_ action can then be adapted to skip any onboarding steps that are present, and as a result we could run the tests asynchronously.

title: Remember comments when app closes
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

### Summary

When typing a comment, it's easy to accidentally swipe down and close the comments section. It erases everything and you must start over. Solution is to temporarily view the post again, it should remember what you've already typed when it's reopened and you can simply start where you left off.

title: Investigate alternative to check if images are cached without store data
description:
### Summary

The current implementation of the data saver feature is storing one record for each image to mark an image as cached.

We should search for an alternative to not store this data because of the performance implications of it.

### Platform information 

iOS/Android

title: Mobile onboarding issues
description:
## Martin Issues

- [ ] Speak Your Mind is not correctly aligned in composer
- [ ] In hashtag selection step, unselected hashtags should be white not filled in
- [ ] Buttons should be different color when active / non-active so user knows they can click
- [ ] Top section of discovery does not load on first landing, loads slowly / secondary every other time you go there
- [ ] Update toaster text when onboarding is completed to say "Setup complete. You are now ready to earn tokens!"

## Mark/Backend Issues

- [ ] Trigger welcome notifications when a new user signs up 
- [ ] Expand channel and group recommendation lists to display as many as we are able to
- [ ] Recommend channels who have received the highest engagement on content using the hashtags you save
- [ ] Recommend groups who have a keyword match to the hashtags you save
- [ ] Send notification when onboarding is completed and user earns first token
- [ ] Users who have already onboarded to rewards system should not receive onboarding
- [ ] Do not show Minds+ content in top section of regular discovery (blurred images)
- [ ] Horizontal recommendations to subscribe to channels in first section of newsfeed for new users


## Decisions
- [ ] What things are remaining for "Improve your experience" and how long will it take?
- [ ] If the continued onboard for mobile only has two steps, we should combine everything into the initial onboarding (michael's opinion)
- [ ] After completing "Complete to earn tokens" I am brought immediately to "Improve your experience" which seems odd (think martin added a delay)

## Completed

- [x] Require hashtag selection before landing on the app (it should then show as completed when you go into the earn tokens steps)
- [x] User should land on For You discovery page after hashtag selections. 
- [x] Add "Start Earning Tokens" button to the top of the For You discovery page and newsfeed 
- [x] After I subscribe to a group and channel under 'improve your experience' the bar will not go away on newsfeed
- [x] Change 'Welcome to planet minds' to just empty with 'Speak your mind...' 
- [x] Phone number verification input seems to have lots of spacing in it. Also, the 'confirm' button should be visible when the keyboard is active. Currently it's hidden behind the active keyboard. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2862)
- [x] Initial signup screen skewed
- [x] Newsfeed still says 'start earning tokens' after finishing the initial phase. Shouldnt it say improve your experience...
- [x] No channels show when tapping subscribe to a channel
- [x] Groups text is greyed out
- [x] Once initial onboarding is completed, and the user is returned to the newsfeed, a toast notification should be displayed for the user. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2861)
- [x] Reduce horizontal spacing between tags as to increase the numbers of tags per row. On my iPhone X, I'm averaging 2 per would. Would be ideal to get 3 per row. Also, please confirm the border radius and font weight of the tag text matches the designs. It currently looks a little off.
- [x] Did not receive tokens when completed set up
- [x] Group names not showing in groups list
- [x] Double blue sections are confusing, I would remove email section as it is within the other section
- [x] The uploaded avatar does not appear in the header (top-left)
- [x] The old verify email banner should be removed (see https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/aOdaOp)
- [x] Upon completing 'complete to start earning tokens' return the user to the newsfeed.
- [x] The onboarding panels should be dismissible if the user doesn't wish to complete the steps. Notice the ellipsis top-right (https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/ZzzQKv)
- [x] When selecting tags, the selected tags are affecting the presentation of the others tags. I'm observing weird jumps and re-ordering of the other tags.
- [x] Keyboard should be open by default on captcha (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2858)
- [x] Keyboard should be open by default on phone verification (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2858)
- [x] "Make first post" doesn't receive a strikethrough after posting
- [x] Stories should not be empty (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2831)
- [x] Avatar not appearing once uploaded (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2856)
- [x] Messenger landing page does not work (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2854)
- [x] Email confirmation bar should disappear automatically upon confirmation (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2850)
- [x] Unable to place cursor inbetween letters in display name on "Setup channel" (I wonder if we should just have it appear blank so they have to write it in fully. We need spaces in their names so search works) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2859)
- [x] Cannot upload avatar, blue circle appears and the upload/ take a photo options don’t go away, avatar never loads
- [x] “Plus” icon in avatar upload button is not centered

description:
### Summary

Attempting to use Minds in splits screen mode forces the app to logout. I was not able to capture this in a recording, and was sent to a weird purgatory logout, but in off camera attempts it did fully log me out.

### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

Android 10, app version 4.5.2

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

When split screen mode is engaged, the login session is forcefully ended. Note that I was only able to achieve this when Minds was opened second in split screen mode. Never when opened first.

title: Implement revised activity posts
description:
Activity posts have been revised so the web and mobile version are better aligned. The changes to be made on mobile are quite minimal.

See below link to sketch cloud assets.
https://www.sketch.com/s/13b32a40-bb2c-48a7-94c9-7fd8674aa1cf/a/32kAro

### Notes
* The header items are all contained on a single row. Display / channel name, avatar and ellipsis.
* Where there is no display name, the channel name will display in the same styling as the display name
* view and date will be displayed at the bottom left of the activity post.
* Any badges, e.g. Minds+ badge to be displayed at the right side of the date/views.

title: Stories Review
description:
![Screenshot_2020-10-26_at_16.07.51](/uploads/6f6b013f9f0477726b6ba1367df750d4/Screenshot_2020-10-26_at_16.07.51.png)

- [x] Only channels with 'unseen' content should have a yellow stroke. Where a user has seen all posts belonging to a channel, the yellow stroke should be removed, and the avatar moved towards the end of the list.
- [x] If I subscribe to a channel with stories, I can't see any corresponding content in the story component. Even when pulling to refresh, or pressing the home button. Ultimately I need to kill and relaunch the app to see any story content for the newly subscribed channel.
- [x] The user should be able to add text to a post. Currently this is not possible.
- [x] The trash can icon isn't required (see above) and can be removed
- [x] The `x` above should be replace with a `back arrow`
- [x] The send button top right should be visible, but disabled when an image/video is being uploaded. Currently it is invisible, then appears once the upload is complete.
- [x] Monetize shouldn't be an option for stories (please correct me if I'm wrong here @ottman @jotto141)
- [x] Schedule post shouldn't be an available option 

cc @markeharding - following on from earlier.

title: Remove NSFW settings on iOS
description: Remove the NSFW options from the settings screen on iOS devices

title: Channel Header Styling Issues
description:
As a point of reference, please see the below screenshot comparing the header on the newsfeed, versus the channel.

![Screenshot_2020-10-26_at_14.54.30](/uploads/45ed573edad7cfd077aa4c6d95f602c3/Screenshot_2020-10-26_at_14.54.30.png)

- [ ] The height of the channel header should match the height of the newsfeed header
- [ ] The drop shadow as seen on the newsfeed header should continue through to the channel
- [ ] The search input should be accessible within channel header
- [ ] Change 'Views' to icon (see below) to account for overflow

Ref channel designs on sketch cloud -> https://www.sketch.com/s/b7570ac0-3b2e-4a91-bca0-f9c5942fc89f/a/jmW7ez

cc @msantang78 - could you assign accordingly. If you've any questions, please let me know.

title: Check sound logic on iOS
description:
- we are defaulting to audio on loud when the phone is in silent mode.
if the user has silent mode on, the default audio should be muted. we should turn on audio if they turn up the volume, or turn off silent mode.
- If you mute a video in your feed, and then scroll down, the next video you see freezes and autoplay does not trigger. you have to press pause, then press play again, and then the audio is back on loud.

title: Mobile comments review
description:
The new comments are looking very good on mobile. Few minor observations are listed below, that would be good to address before releasing the build.

For reference please see the original designs here -> https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/mZq7DV

- [x] The close button (x) is missing from the top-right of the comment area. (#2955)
- [x] The comment count is not displayed (to the right of comments) (#2954)
- [x] If the user chooses to close the comments pane by tapping on the outer area at the top of the screen, the elements underneath the overlay are 'tappable'. In this case, the comments pane should disappear only, any the underlying elements shold not be tappable. (#2962)
- [x] The tappable area on the comment ellipsis is quite small. Could this area be increased, as it takes me multiple attempts to action it.
- [x] When viewing the comment action sheet, the user should be able to exit the sheet simply by tapping the outer area. Currently the only exit option is to tap 'cancel'. (#2962)
- [x] Please reduce the line spacing ever so slightly between the channel name and time ago value in the comment. (d741d7062c4b568965c2f322454f5d95522795a8)
- [x] If in the event there are zero comments on a post, and the user taps the comment icon from within their feed, could we activate the keyboard and focus on the comment input? (dc7038082e8da0fb25682d13f8d26f42890fab34) 
- [x] On the comment input, the tappable area around the ellipsis is very small and should be increased so it is more accessible. (5198a5d4e2dbfed837e19177aa5f5b9d779df2e6)
- [x] Tapping the ellipsis within the comment inout, launches the media gallery. The intention was to also include 'Mark as explicit' which is currently omitted. Is it still important to include the explicit option when adding a comment @ottman @jotto141 (ref -> https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/1avzDp) (#2967)
- [x] In addition to 'select photo/video from gallery', can we also include an option to 'take picture/video'? (#2967)
- [x] When viewing a reply to long comment, the following issue is observed. (c8e631ab3ede9aa355ef0295b07688431f336501) ![IMG_1352](/uploads/ac96200358299483bc993e7debb9ad7b/IMG_1352.PNG)


cc @markeharding @jotto141 @ottman 
Looks great all round! It should be a big step forward to release the new comments.

### Summary

Seems like the expo package is requiring the expo-location which adds location permissions even if the app doesn't use it.

According to new Google terms we need to remove it

title: Ambiguous mobile content upload error - (Major pain point from every new user I brought in)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)
New users who have not yet verified their email will be presented with generic errors when trying to upload images on the mobile app (something along the lines of "upload failed"). It has resulted in major frustration and an impression of a buggy app.


### Steps to reproduce

Sign up.
Don't realize that you need to verify your email.
Try to upload content on the mobile app

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

(What actually happens)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

title: Updated and unified timestamp conventions
description:
Time ago timestamps are displayed inconsistently throughout the web and mobile applications.

Please see below a clarification of how these dates should be displayed across mobile and web.

Dates can be displayed in one of two contexts:

1. Feed view. Utilise time ago values in the following short format.

* `8s` = '8 seconds ago'
* `30m` = '30 mins ago'
* `22h` = '22 hours ago'
* `Jun 14` = 'Anything that 24 hours or older. Do not display the year, where it is the current year'
* `Dec 25 2020` = 'Date from the previous calendar year'

2. Post context: When displaying a post outside of a feed, the full date/time should be displayed.

* `Jan 14 2021 · 1:42 am` / `14 Jan 2021 · 17:01`.

(Ideally the date time should be localised accordingly). e.g. FR -> `le 5 avril · 17:01`, DE -> `15. Juni 2021 · 15:22` etc...

![Screenshot_2021-06-15_at_15.26.43](/uploads/2054712560c5e6de3933e1811f1d0230/Screenshot_2021-06-15_at_15.26.43.png)

title: Implement revised comments for mobile
description:
A redesigned and improved structure for mobile should be implemented.

Please see a simple click-through here: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/ePq1Z2/play

The included design cover light-mode. A single dark-mode screen may be found here: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/aYvzyZ

### Notes
* Comments should no longer be displayed in a nested fashion. Instead, each level of comments is displayed within its own screen. This approach is clearer, and gives ore screen real estate for comments and comment creation.
* The term 'comment' applies only to top-level comment items. Anything deeper should simply be referred to as a 'reply'.
* There are two new filter options related to comments. 'Top' and 'Latest'. Note that these filter options apply only to top-level comments, and not replies.
  * Top: This is the default selection, where comments with the most up-votes are displayed first.
  * Latest: Comments arranged from oldest to newest
* When a user taps on a comment, they are brought to this screen here, where the selected comment is displayed at the very top. https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/nvqYPa
* Explicit comments: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/wKpjqm
* Embedded URL comment: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/pOpoRR
* Embedded video or image comment: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/VjmYp7
* Long comments/replies:
* * Collapsed: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/Y4ArKO
* * Expanded: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/KVbLO1
* When replying to a comment, the reply should be reinforced by displaying the relevant channel : https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/xqe8PW
* Tapping the ellipsis next to any comment/reply: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/O9ZYD2
* Tapping filter option on comments pannel: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/AdL8vM
* Long comment/reply: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/EOY1gO
* * When ellipsis is tapped: https://www.sketch.com/s/242fed11-027a-48de-b053-6d4cc89bed75/a/1avzDp

title: Composer: Media preview is different from the feed's Media view
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

There are reports that the media preview in the composer is cropped and not showing the full picture. We should ideally show the picture in the original aspect ratio, or at least in the same way it's going to be shown in the feed

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

Media previews in the composer should reflect how the post is shown in the feed.
We should use the new media preview only for multiple images.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

Visual

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

not required, but good to have

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->

All

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

N/A

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] composer shows images in the same way as the feed

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Disable supermind request buttons if it is expired
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The supermind request buttons should be hidden if the supermind is expired by checking the dates, even if the status is not expired. The backend takes time to update the status of the request and it can be incorrect.

### Steps to reproduce

- Open a request that is just expired

title: Login/register with Keyboard
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Login with keyboard
- focus by default on first input (exist)
- focus on next input by pressing enter on keyboard
- submit form by pressing enter on keyboard

## What needs to be done

- Update login and register forms, 
- Add refs to TextInput components
- Add onSubmitEditing callbacks
- Configure Enter keyboard with Next/Submit, where possible

## QA

Normal testing

## UX/Design

N/A


## Acceptance Criteria

GIVEN that I'm on the login screen
AND the focus is on the username field
AND the keyboard is visible
WHEN I fill the username field
AND I press Enter
Than I will see the focus on move to the password field

GIVEN that I'm on the login screen
AND the focus is on the password field
AND the keyboard is visible
WHEN I fill the password field
AND I press Enter
Than I will attempt to login
AND the spinner on the login button will be visible

GIVEN that I'm on the register screen
AND the focus is on the username field
AND the keyboard is visible
WHEN I fill the username field
AND I press Enter
Than I will see the focus on move to the email field

GIVEN that I'm on the register screen
AND the focus is on the email field
AND the keyboard is visible
WHEN I fill the email field
AND I press Enter
Than I will see the focus on move to the password field

GIVEN that I'm on the register screen
AND the focus is on the password field
AND the keyboard is visible
WHEN I fill the password field
AND I press Enter
Than I will see the focus on move to the T&C checkbox field

- [x] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [x] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [x] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Tabbar Performance issue
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Some users are experiencing slowness on the tab bar. The culprit could be any of the following:

1. [we're detaching inactive tabs](https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/blob/9f72906d3a115e7109b2ab8bb0f1853dd78ff129/src/tabs/TabsScreen.tsx#L170)
2. [unmounting the "Drawer tab"](https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/blob/9f72906d3a115e7109b2ab8bb0f1853dd78ff129/src/tabs/TabsScreen.tsx#L264) when user leaves it
3. The tab indicator animation (it's okay to remove this if we identified it as the cause)

### Steps to reproduce

on a low-end android device, try to switch tabs from a fresh app state

### Platform information 

both but mostly noticeable on android devices, especially low-end

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

tabs change with slight delay and the tab indicator lags

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

tabs should change smoothly

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

TBD

### Possible fixes

explained in summary

title: Display offer statuses within Supermind console
description:
## Goal

Improve usability of the supermind console by allowing the user to filter by type.

The console is currently split into `inbound` and `outbound`. However, within inbound for example, there is no easy way to discern between pending requests, from expired or delivered - consequently it could potentially become quite noisy.

## What needs to be done

Update the display of Supermind offers in the inbox and outbox to indicate their status

Statuses include:
- Pending
- Accepted
- Declined
- Expired
- Failed

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

:warning: This task was cloned from the front end
We are going to infer the designs from the front-end ones for now 

### Supermind Console

#### Inbound
- [Inbound - Pending state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1772%3A20454)
- [Inbound - Delivered state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1817%3A21946)
- [Inbound - Expired state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1907%3A21854)

#### Outbound
- [Outbound - Pending state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1772%3A20708)
- [Outbound - Delivered state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1907%3A22099)
- [Outbound - Expired state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1907%3A22359)

## Personas

Creators
Fans

## Experiments

n/a

## Acceptance Criteria

- [x] Display the 'state' in place of 'Expires in ' text shows
- [x] On accepted posts, show the View Reply button

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Mob: Add confirmation step to Supermind reply
description:
## Goal

Re-clarify the terms of accepting/replying to a Supermind offer to avoid surprise / accidents.

## What needs to be done

Add a final confirmation after the user chooses to post a Supermind reply.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1564%3A20078)

![image](/uploads/8a4e8b42212f84de3ee0a5c0e10a369d/image.png)

## Personas

Creators

## Experiments

n/a

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Given the user has filled the composer with a valid reply to the Supermind, when the user clicks `Post`, then the confirmation modal is displayed, and the offer amount is represented in the modal (e.g. `$50` or `5 tokens`).
- [ ] Given the confirmation modal is displayed, when the user clicks the `X` button, then the confirmation modal is closed and the user is returned to the in-progress composer (to make edits, etc.).
- [ ] Given the confirmation modal is displayed, when the `Confirm` button is pressed, then the Supermind reply is posted and the transaction is completed.

description:
### Summary

The supermind cash option is not shown for some users

Probably by the logic to follow: "A user can only pay in cash where the producer has a bank account connected to their minds account" of the creation card
We should follow the front logic and always show the cash option for now (The backend will do the validations)

### Steps to reproduce

The cash option should be always visible on Android

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The cash option is shown to some users only

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Show it to all

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

-

### Possible fixes

Show the cash option on Android

title: Prepare a test build
Clearly communicate refund policy on payment screens
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Clearly communicate refund policy on payment screens so that we are not at risk of losing any disputes on chargebacks and so that the user understands that there are no refunds.

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

On screens involving payments, a confirmation modal require confirmation.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

- Payments cannot be sent unless box is checked that user understands refund policy


## UX/Design

- No design necessary, developers can handle
- Superminds - "I understand this transaction is non-refundable once the recipient approves my offer"
- Memberships - "I understand this transaction is non-refundable"
- Tips - "I understand this transaction is non-refundable"
- Minds+ - "I understand this transaction is non-refundable"
- Minds Pro - "I understand this transaction is non-refundable"

---


Insert a confirmation modal / screen into purchase flows of our monetization products. The modal appears and presents the correct message, and the user can `Confirm` or `Cancel`.

![image](/uploads/7a758eef77fb27c97dd5d535999299e8/image.png)

### Messages

| Purchase type | Message                                                                                                                                                  |
|---------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Supermind     | Are you sure you want to send @username a [amount + currency] offer? This transaction is nonrefundable once the recipient approves your offer.           |
| Membership    | Are you sure you want to join @username's membership? This transaction is nonrefundable.                                                                 |
| Tip           | Are you sure you want to send @username a [amount + currency] tip? This transaction is nonrefundable.                                                    |
| Minds Plus    | Are you sure you want to join Minds Plus? You will be charged [amount + currency] [monthly / annually] at the end of your trial, which is nonrefundable. |
| Minds Pro     | Are you sure you want to join Minds Pro? You will be charged [amount + currency] [monthly / annually], which is nonrefundable.                           |

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->

- Customers are better informed on our refund policy
- Minds admins are better able to respond to chargeback disputes


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

- None


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Superminds cannot be sent unless this box is checked
- [ ] Tips cannot be sent unless this box is checked
- [ ] Minds+ cannot be purchased unless this box is checked
- [ ] Minds Pro cannot be purchased unless this box is checked
- [ ] Memberships cannot be purchased unless this box is checked
- [ ] Refactor wire screen using base components

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Change CI release flow for Android
description:
## Goal

With the new play store review process that may take a few days in some cases, we need to change the release flow on the CI

Currently, we are releasing the full version of the app on the web (custom auto-update) and after that submitting to the play store.

If we want a simultaneous release for iOS, play store, and web we need to send it to the stores first and await approval

I already changed the play store to manage the releases manually (Do not auto-release on approval)

## What needs to be done

- Move the play store to run before the web release
- Since the web release is generating the metadata, used by the play store release job, we need to replicate that into the play store

## QA
-


## UX/Design

-

title: Support for displaying multi-image activity posts
description:
## Goal

Enable Minds users to create activity posts that contain multiple images.

## What needs to be done

Add support for displaying activity posts with multiple images. Activity posts can have up to 4x images. Images are cropped into uniform pieces of a grid. The count of images determines the grid layout.

Tapping an image in this grid opens the image in a modal that enables the user to view the full image [and swipe from one image to the next ?].

title: Display in-app notifications for Superminds
description:
## Goal

Communicate to Supermind users on both sides (fan, creator) important updates about a Supermind offer.

## What needs to be done

Display relevant notifications in the in-app notification notification dropdown / window. Notifications click through to a relevant screen.

| Event                            | Notified user | Clicks to                    | Push notification copy                                |
|----------------------------------|---------------|------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------|
| Sender sends a Supermind offer   | Sender        | n/a                          | n/a                                                   |
| Sender sends a Supermind offer   | Recipient     | Supermind console > Inbound  | @channelName sent you a Supermind offer               |
| Receiver declines an offer       | Sender        | Supermind console > Outbound | @channelName has declined your Supermind offer        |
| Receiver accepts an offer        | Sender        | Activity post URL            | You got a Supermind reply from @channelName           |
| 24 hours before an offer expires | Recipient     | Supermind console > Inbound  | Don't forget to review @channelName's Supermind offer |
| An offer expires                 | Sender        | Supermind console > Outbound | @channelName missed your Supermind offer              |

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

[Notification component (Figma)](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=1024%3A23254)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Supermind notifications appear view with a Supermind-specific icon.
- [ ] Supermind notifications click through to a relevant page/screen.
- [ ] Add a single supermind request screen and navigate from the notifications

both

-

title: New Moment -> Photo -> Download -> Crash
description:
### Summary

The app crashes when trying to Download a photo taken during the "New Moment" creation.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to the Home screen.
2. Press the "New Moment" button.
3. Take a photo.
4. Press the Download button in the top right corner of the screen.
5. The app crashes.

### Platform information 

* Minds for Android v4.26
* Motorola
* Moto G7 Power
* 720 x 1570 pixels
* Android version 10 (QPOS30.52-29-7-6)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The app crashes.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The picture taken a moment ago is saved to the device's storage.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

None. Sorry.

### Possible fixes

I have noticed that manually giving the app the storage access permission on the Android system level stops the app from crashing and the picture is stored on the device's storage as expected. So, it seems the app instead of checking if it has the storage permissions just tries to access it.

title: Supermind creation flow
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
* Allow users to create Supermind requests to send to other users.
* Supermind requests are when a user offers another user tokens or cash to reply to their post.

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->
* Users can create SuperMind requests via a number of entry points.
  * Via an activity post (in-feed or post entity)
  * Via a channel (by clicking `SuperMind` within the header)
  * Via the composer (when creating a post and toggling SuperMind)

**Create Request Flow from Composer**

* Regardless which entry point a user tags, the proceeding flow is the same. The workflow when creating a SuperMind request is outline within the following prototype and detailed below.
  * The compose will launch. The SuperMind badge will appear top-right. Note also the slight change in context of the composer toolbar.
    * Monetise has been removed
    * The post button has been replace with a continue button.
    * \[Confirm which options to be omitted from the ellipsis menu\]
  * When a user presses continued, they will be brought to the SuperMind screen. Here the user can confirm the targeted channel, define an offer amount and currency type.
    * A user can pay in either tokens or cash.
    * A user can only pay in cash where the producer has a bank account connected to their minds account.
    * Where the producer does not have a connected bank account, the consumer will not see a cash option
  * When a SuperMind request is made, there are a total of four response types. There are:
    * Any reply (Text)
    * Video Reply
    * Image Reply
    * Remind
  * It is assumed that Twitter integration will not be required for the first iteration.
  * Where a minimum offer value is present, a user can not submit a request where the minimum offer has not be satisfied.
  * Once the user presses ‘Send Request’ a notice will display informing them that the request has been sent and when to expect a reply.

**Create Request from Activity Post in Feed**

* A new `S` SuperMind icon is to appear within the activity post interactions, replacing tip. Tip is to be moved within the ellipsis menu.
* After clicking on the SuperMind prompt, the the composer will launch with the quoted post in-view.
* Additionally, we may want to draw attention to the `SuperMind` button within the activity post (feed).
  * Where a user interests with a post (i.e. up-vote) we could highlight the SuperMind button my means of a popover.
  * See proposed flow here -> **[Supermind Init via post - prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=303%3A9795&viewport=-9081%2C5560%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=303%3A9795&show-proto-sidebar=1)**

**Via the Composer**

* Additionally users may create SuperMind requests from within the composer, without being referred from a post or from within the channel.
* Note the inclusion of the new `S` / SuperMind icon with the composer toolbar.
  * As the user types, if they enter a valid channel name, attention should be brought to the `S` icon with a tooltip.
  * Clicking the `S` will lunch the SuperMind screen, where they can define the target, currency type, bid etc.
  * Alternatively the user can simply open the SuperMind menu without necessarily specifying a channel name within the composer itself.
* See prototype here -> **[Supermind init via composer - prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=447%3A14608&viewport=-9081%2C5560%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=447%3A14608&show-proto-sidebar=1)**

**Via the channel**

* Supermind CTA will only appear when viewing someone else's channel. See prototype below.
* **[Supermind init via channel - prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=303%3A9203&viewport=2397%2C-4957%2C0.5&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=303%3A9203&show-proto-sidebar=1)**

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] See: https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/5713

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Initiate a Supermind from channel page
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
- Allow users to send a Supermind request to a channel from that person's channel page

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->
* There are to be two modifications with respect the channel page.
* `SuperMind CTA`
  * A `SuperMind` call-to-action will appear top-right. It will remain visible whether a user is subscribed [Subscribed visitor state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=457%3A13518)or [Unsubscribed visitor state](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=303%3A9203) to the channel being viewed.
  * The `SuperMind` button will not be visible when displaying one’s own channel.
  * **[Unit supermind from channel - prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=303%3A9203&viewport=-9081%2C5560%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=303%3A9203&show-proto-sidebar=1)**
* New filter option
  * A new `Type` filter option should be made available, allowing users to filter a channel feed by `SuperMind` - this will display all SuperMind content relative to the channel. [New channel filter type](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=455%3A12901)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->
