title: Implement Supermind settings
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
-- Build out settings screen for users to manage Supermind related settings such as minimum offer thresholds 


## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

* [Supermind Settings Prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=974%3A17359&viewport=-9081%2C5560%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=974%3A17359&show-proto-sidebar=1)
* There is no ability to enable or disable this feature.
* Supermind will be available to all users.
* Supermind settings is contained within `Settings` > `Account` and offers the user the ability to define a minimum offer amount for both USD and Tokens.
* Where the user does not have a connected bank account, they will be prompted from within settings to connect their bank account, before then being able to define a minimum USD offer.
* Supermind settings will be linked also from the `Supermind console`.
* Token values less than one may not be entered.
* Cash (USD) values less than $10 may not be entered.


## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

* [ ] Add options for token and USD minimums in Settings using existing backend endpoint
* [ ] Default to: 1 token, 10 USD
* [ ] Prevent user from entering values lower than: 1 token, 10 USD

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Improve the startup speed and initial memory consumption by lazy loading screens
description:
## Goal

Improve the startup speed and initial memory consumption by lazy loading screens.

The metro bundler has an `inline require` that lazy loads the modules and a babel plugin that transforms the imports into inline requires when possible. 
Seems like this babel module is not working or it is not transforming the imports for the screens.


## What needs to be done

Use inline requires for the screens


```js
import PhoneValidationScreen from '../onboarding/v2/steps/PhoneValidationScreen';
<RootStackNav.Screen
   name="PhoneValidation"
   component={PhoneValidationScreen}
/>
```

```js
<RootStackNav.Screen
   name="PhoneValidation"
   getComponent={() =>
     require('../onboarding/v2/steps/PhoneValidationScreen').default
   }
/>
```

## QA

TBD


## UX/Design

none


## Personas

UX improved reducing the app startup time

## Experiments
none


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] App should lazy load the screens
- [ ] functionality should not be affected

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Investigate a permanent solution for the crop image picker on Android
description:
### Summary

The crop image picker is randomly resetting the application after selecting a new image (when it tries to navigate to the crop activity)

I researched a little about this and even tried to migrate it to the expo-image-picker, but it also suffers from the same issue. It seems to be an Android issue that is killing the activities to save resources.

If no solution is found we will have to implement a camera screen with a crop functionality in-app

### Steps to reproduce

It happens when trying to take a picture for the avatar (Currently disabled on Android as a temporary solution)

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

app restart

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

move to crop screen

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Related to https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/30277

### Possible fixes

Check if the current expo is solving the issue and if there's an alternate solution at hand (new version of the image picker).

title: "Subscribers you know" list
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Now we have 'also subscribed to' blocks on channels, we want to expand to be able to see more than 2 results. 

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

We already have a modal that displays for subscribes on notifications, this is just a time ordered list. Modify this modal to support mutual 'also subscribed to'. The backend needs a slight tweak to support pagination.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

The modal display when relevant.

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

?

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->

Subscribers.

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

M/A


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Click on the component will launch a modal (same as what is currently used to display who up-voted a post) and list any mutual subscriptions, or redirect to a channel.
  * [ ] clicking directly on a channel handle will direct the user to that channel
  * [ ] clicking on `x others` or any of the avatars will launch a the modal.
- [ ] Backend to support pagination. ie `LIMIT 12,20` in the SQL statement will offset to 20-32 results.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Upload apks to browserstack

Version bump and language update
Improve mobile error message and add retry logic
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The error message shown on a failed request (as below on failed upvote) is not helpful to the user or developer.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Lose connectivity.
2. Try upvote something.

### Platform information

Cross-platform mobile.

### App version

v3.12.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Generic error is shown to user.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

should show an alert / modal to the user informing them of the error (voting could not be done). Also a retry button would be ideal.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Screenshot_20191214-132038_Minds](/uploads/9a1caae9152f48fb9e3e043fc309c1f0/Screenshot_20191214-132038_Minds.jpg)

### Possible fixes

- [ ] Add specific error messages to retry failures
- [ ] Add a retry button for failed network requests (if possible without significant re-architecture)

/label ~"T \- Bug" ~"S \- Triage:new"

title: Remove onboarding progress bar on channel until working correctly
description:
The Onboarding completion widget on channels is not working. We should remove this until it is working properly. See video.

I can't upload a video of the full process, but I have tried doing this many times and filling out the complete form, including verifying my phone number, but it always tells me I am not completed, and it does not seem to be remembering the information I enter for the Location, Birthday, and Phone (not depicted in video). You also have to press Continue twice on the final screen.

![RPReplay_Final1587671085](/uploads/8f6f7bd0d1f2cbab869578f29559bc56/RPReplay_Final1587671085.MP4)

title: Creating a remind looks skewed and has strange navigation back to composer
description:
See video. Confusing user experience.

Steps to replicate:
1. Click to remind a post with a native image.
2. Notice how much space there is for Speak Your Mind, there is far too much space
3. Click on the native image
4. Navigate back
5. Notice you are now in the composer, and not the Remind composer (where you just were) as expected.

![RPReplay_Final1587670888](/uploads/89ba40cb473065a529c3a16bbe3aaf5b/RPReplay_Final1587670888.MP4)

title: Navigation issues from Post Options
description:
Navigating back from tag manager is confusing. See steps to replicate below.

Steps to replicate:
1. Open composer
2. Go to text option
3. Click to add tags
4. Add a few hashtags
5. If you tap Done, it navigates you back to the Photo screen, which is confusing and makes it seem like nothing worked. It should take you to the status screen, where the tags show. If you tap back, it navigates you back to the Photo screen. It should also take you to the status screen. This is happening with all Post Options.

Solution: Any time you navigate back, or press "Done" in any Post Options, you should be navigated back to the Text screen, where you can see the status and any uploaded media if applicable.

release 4.0.2
Newsfeed image size issues
description:
I suspect this is going to be a hard problem to solve consistently without rolling out a more adaptive layout system, but, this is a good place to start the conversation

@Johnthetester and Chesscats reported display issues with images on the feed. It's not just constrained to landscape mode. There's portrait mode images that overrun the view port as well.

![IMG_0CA149FECD66-1](/uploads/d88238a80613a82207e1d77dee37d139/IMG_0CA149FECD66-1.jpeg)

![IMG_159F912DC5C3-1](/uploads/6326efa1567505bbdc9b9f4e78995bfc/IMG_159F912DC5C3-1.jpeg)

This is, however, a hard problem.

If we scale portrait pictures down to fit in landscape, they will be very tiny and very narrow.

Same thing happens if we scale landscape photos down to fit on portrait, we will have a very tall viewport and a very thin and narrow image

Clipping and centering images so the post fits and so users can click through to see the whole thing might be the best way to solve this. But I'll defer to the @michaelfbradley @jotto141  and @ottman on how we want to address these layout issues.

title: Implement the YT Importer settings screens (mobile)
description:
Under the "Other" Activity, add the UI for importing YT videos

https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%23-youtube-migration/#artboard0

- [ ] Add yt importer settings under the new settings pages behind the "ytimporter" feature flag.

If the user entity does not have the "yt_connected" timestamp on their user model

- [ ] Show the Google oauth handler flow 

When the user authorizes the account call the v2/media/import/auth/:user_guid with the information required to link their accounts

If the user is connected

- [ ] Show a list of videos to import on the available screen. Paginated with infinite scroll
   - [ ] Limits should be coming from the backend 
   - [ ] Number of queued videos, number of videos being transferred
- [ ] Transfer all videos should kick off a backend request that cause the backend import to import all of the videos available and queue them up for transferring
- [ ] Cancel should send a request to the backend to delete the video from being transferred
- [ ] I suspect Canceling a video that is currently transferring is going to be very hard to do with the fire and forget nature of the transcoder. This feature should get postponed unless @eiennohi finds an easy way to kill a transcoder job mid flight.
- [ ] Transfer button on individual videos should schedule an individual video
- [ ] Transferred should show a list of all videos imported. Paginated with infinite scroll
- [ ] Empty screens for no videos on youtube or transferred
- [ ] Config sections that updates the user's imported web hooks and allows them to disconnect by calling a delete on the /media/video/auth endpoint
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] E2E (not actually testing the YT integration, we'll need to confirm how detox handles 3rd party calls and mocked responses)

Composer

- [x] Ability to hold the compose button and record (let go to stop. Tap to record as well) from the base navigation (Or atleast from the red button)

Settings

- [x] Language selector undesigned

If we can control them through the unleash feature flags without causing massive activity headaches, we should do set it up so we can control this feature through gitlab.

- [ ] Turn on wallet features for ios
- [ ] Test all wallet, boost and wire to make sure everything works in ios
- [ ] Submit the app to apple as soon as possible so we can either get it approved or separate out what they reject

title: App audio setting should override phone audio setting
description:
Example:

- User has phone on silent mode (iOS)
- User scrolls to video on Minds app and presses play
- Video should play muted by default (this currently is how it works)
- If user unmutes video, the sound should turn on regardless of whether phone is in silent mode.
- All videos on Minds app should inherit the same audio setting from the last post.

title: Endless loading screen for new user in USD transactions
description:
If you are a new user or have no USD transactions, it shows an endless loading sign.

Instead it should just show text that says "You do not have any transactions"

title: Remove ability to switch camera when recording
description:
If you are capturing a video and try to press the flip camera icon, it makes the video stop recording.

Ideally, users should be able to do this mid video. If this is a longer-term fix, then perhaps just remove the ability to do so while capturing a video. However, it is much better and industry standard to have this capability for taking videos.

To replicate:
1. Open composer and switch to video
2. Press record
3. Press flip camera while recording

title: Onboarding crashes after selecting hashtags
description:
There are two crash points when trying to create a new user and complete onboarding.

The first crash occurs due to fast swiping immediately after you create an account #2216 - it seems like we unnecessarily have screens swiping in and out. It should just load and have the first onboarding screen automatically up when a user first signs up. After that, every time they open the app it should just be on newsfeed or wherever they were last. 

The second crash occurs after you press Next after selecting hashtags (see video).

title: Cannot play video preview after capturing video from phone
description:
Steps to replicate:

1. Open composer on iPhone
2. Take a video from your phone
3. Notice that you are unable to watch the preview of the video when deciding to Confirm or Retake
4. Press confirm. When you try to play the video from within the preview, the app crashes and gives white screen (error below)

Video:

![RPReplay_Final1591026214](/uploads/cfae6e1865acbda9236a5e571ef6e995/RPReplay_Final1591026214.MP4)

2. Notice you are taken to the For You screen

title: Revised Registration and Onboarding
description:
This is the mobile equivalent take of https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/3834

### Designs
- [Registration] https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/88bLQx/play
- [Initial On-boarding] https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/aOdaOp/play 

The web and mobile functionality is by and large comparable, so please use the above issue as a reference.

This feature can be broken into two functional areas.

### Registration
The initial registration process has been simplified, including just the main registration screen and tag selection

### Initial onboarding
List of six steps a user should complete before being able to earn tokens

### Continued onboard
_Screens to follow_

Note: Happy to arrange a walk through with whoever is implementing this task.

title: Drawer link paddings are not evenly spaced
description:
### Summary

Drawer links padding is not evenly spaced and so if you press even a little above the desired link, the above link will be pressed. This happened to me a lot 

### Platform information 

All platforms

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Padding should be evenly spaced so the links will have a friendlier touchability

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/8f637b087c3c1157d4750dbb969e71a2/image.png)

### Possible fixes

Evenly spaced padding will fix the issue

title: Portrait changes
description:
- [ ] Change the post's order to be newest last (inside users)
- [ ] Change order of the users to be: users with newest posts first
- [ ] Move users with no unseen posts to the end of the feed

title: Cannot upload an image iOS14
description:
When uploading an image from gallery nothing happens when you tap the picture icon. The issue seems to be introduced by iOS 14.


iOS  14 (latest)
Minds 4.4.1 (current production release)
Testflight 4.5  also affected

When you tap the picture icon to open the gallery, nothing happens.

title: UI freezes when a video is paused on iOS
description:
### Summary

When scrolling on the feed and a video is automatically paused, it causes a jump on the scroll because it freezes for a moment the UI thread of react-native.

### Steps to reproduce

Scroll until you find a video (with autoplay activated)
Scroll until the video is paused.

### Platform information 

iOS

title: Some activities in feed were failing to show
description: The problem was that LinearGradient component was undefined due to a bad import

  at value (app:///[native code])
...
(26 additional frame(s) were not displayed)
```

title: TypeError: JSON.stringify cannot serialize cyclic structures.
description:
Seems like it is still happening on current production version, check if it is fixed on the current dev branch (4.4.0)

Sentry Issue: [MOBILE-1AW](https://sentry.io/organizations/minds-inc/issues/1638031421/?referrer=gitlab_integration)

```
TypeError: JSON.stringify cannot serialize cyclic structures.
  at stringify (app:///[native code])
  at None (src/common/services/sql/entities.storage.ts:27:9)
  at callImmediates (app:///[native code])
  at value (app:///[native code])

title: Revised mobile login and registration
description:
The current login and registration process is visually speaking a little flat. This issue relates only to improving the visual aspect of login and registration, and does not include any functional changes.

Latest mobile designs can be found here -> https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%23-registration/

### Notes
* A continually looping video will play in the background through these screens.
* When going from one screen to the next, the video state should persist (i.e. it does not restart)
* When navigating to any screen that contains inputs, the keyboard should activate automatically on the first input
* The registration page contains only a single password input field (previously two)
* The CAPTCHA input appears within a drawer that slides up (and not an overlay as it currently is)
* Currently there are lots of issues within registration when the keyboard is active. The inputs exceed the available space on the screen, and accessing inputs outside of the viewports proves to be quite awkward. The improved designs contained above reduces the likelihood of inputs appearing outside of the viewport, so hopefully this goes some way in improving the registration experience.
* When defining a password the following popover should appear. Only green ticks should appear as the various criteria are satisfied. The red crosses that are currently implemented, should not appear at all https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%23-registration/#artboard3 

Video background demo
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1S2oTsaA7vDInGr8Fgx3W5qmPFXVkCIK7/view?usp=sharing

Video Loop MP4
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F1ge65Ez_PhoeS_v_8sOTEfrU1wn4S41/view?usp=sharing

cc @msantang78

title: WIP: Better Touchables
description:
General improvements in intractability and expectability of the app

## Touchability

- small, borderless elements should have larger hitslops than their size
    - all icons on topbar
        - e.g. topbar back icon
        - e.g. channel top bar ellipsis icon
    - profile icon on main topbar
    - TBD
- elements with a clear border should have a native touchable feedback
    - listItems
        - settings
        - bottom sheets
    - drawer list items
    - settings list items
    - report list items
    - ChannelListItem and group list items
    - TBD
- optional: elements with touchable opacity should have a reduced active opacity
- newsfeed images could have a subtle native touchable feedback (like tw)

## Gestures

- screens should be dismissable from a swipe-in from left on iOS and Android
- portrait viewer should be dismissable with a swipe down from anywhere on the portrait mode

## Navigation and Transitions

- page transitions should have a card stack style like on iOS native, like twitter, and like Telegram
- pressing newsfeed should smooth scroll to top

## UI

- screen header consistency: currently some pages use native headers, and some js headers
    - decide between native or js navbars and apply to all pages

title: Stories UX upgrade
description: **Note**: I'm not sure what the thinking behind the Stories are and what their purpose is but I'm able to see all the stories a user has ever published, which could be potentially a lot, and don't know what to make of that. That's why I can't comment any further than this. Do we have a way to track the performance of specific features and measure their success? or IOW, how do we know whether a big feature, such as Stories, is being successful, to know whether to continue developing it or deprecate it? --- ### Minor UX change - [ ] Tapping on the left side of the screen when a video is playing may restart the video - [ ] Tap and hold may pause videos - [ ] page indicator may be wider for the active page and fill up according to the video progress. Previous pages should be grayed. - [ ] when stories are active the device shouldn't go to sleep (or when videos are playing) - [ ] share dialog opens too quick. it should open with the same speed as other dialogs - [ ] stories loading placeholder doesn't start only after the newsfeed items have loaded. The loading should start at the same time as the newsfeed loading - [ ] swiping guide is shown everytime after opening the app. It should be shown only once. - [ ] swiping gesture on stories has to have a shorter activation gesture distance - [ ] Deleting a story doesn't have a feedback and doesn't remove the story from the list until the list is manually refreshed - [ ] Posting a new story/post will jump the feed scroll position to the second index (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3361) ### Major UX change - [ ] Swiping up from a story may show the comments beneath the story and more details like date and views. Instead of having these indicators on the story itself - [ ] Stories UI openning has to have an animation so users aren't confused about the navigation change - [ ] Stories UI navbar could be simplified (not a fullwidth view) - [ ] Stories UI should be dismissable with a downswipe - [ ] Photo/Story preview after taking a photo is not good ### Speculative - [ ] Double tapping a story could upvote it. Double tap has become a common gesture for approval

title: Fix code warnings and enable LogBox
description:
Fix code warning:
 - key for Portrait bar
 - componentWillMount
 - key for OwnerComponent
 - find/fix other warnings 

Enable LogBox

title: Implement the MMKV storage
description:
Implement MMKV in replacement for AsyncStorage:

We are going to use 4 storages:
1. Session: cleared when the user logs out
2. User: persistent for each user. 
2. UserCache: persistent for each user. Add an option to clear it from settings
3. App: For permanent settings and information across the app (language, data saver, theme, etc)

- [x] Implement new storage
- [x] Improve app initialization taking advantage of the MMKV sync methods
- [x] Implement a migration from AsyncStorage to MMKV to avoid losing sessions and settings with the update
- [x] Replace session storage
- [x] Replace settings storage
- [x] Replace cache storage for requests
- [x] Replace portrait storage and implement TTL
- [x] Refactor update service to use MMKV
- [x] Refactor search bar to use new storage
- [x] Refactor and replace offline data cache using MMKV
  - [x] Entities
  - [x] Channels
  - [x] Feeds
  - [x] Comments
- [x] Remove SQL package and logic
- [x] Fix spec tests
- [x] Fix typescript errors

title: UX Review
description: ## This is WIP These early issues are just a warm-up and include very small issues, proposed features, and many bugs. These are still very random but I'll reorganize them at a later time. The next step is to have a UX discussion and discuss higher level problems and ideas. * note: I wanted to create issues for these but thought that would crowd the issues list. So I'll list them here first. * note: Some of these things (which are the tip of the iceberg) may be considered nit-picky but an elegant UI is all about the details and to make something truly simple one has to do complex things * note: In many of these cases the issue may become irrelevant because the parent of those issues may need to be changed. --- - [x] Splash Screen: first impression matters. The splash screen can be enhanced in a way that the light bulb of the minds logo lights up the whole screen and disappears showing the app content. This also gives more identity to the app. This is just one idea for the splash on top of my head (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3402) - [x] Stories: Tapping on the left side of the screen when a video is playing should restart the video (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Tap and hold should pause videos (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: page indicator should be wider for the active page and fill up according to the video progress. Previous pages should be greyed. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: when stories are active the device shouldn't go to sleep (or when videos are playing) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Swiping up from a story should show the comments beneath the story and more details like date and views. Instead of having these indicators on the story itself (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: double tapping a story could upvote it. Double tap has become a common gesture for approval (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: share dialog opens too quick. it should open with the same speed as other dialogs (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: stories loading placeholder doesn't start only after the newsfeed items have loaded. The loading should start at the same time as the newsfeed loading (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI openning has to have an animation so users aren't confused about the navigation change (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI navbar could be simplified (not a fullwidth view) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Stories UI should be dismissable with a downswipe (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: Photo/Story preview after taking a photo is not good (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: swiping guide is shown everytime after opening the app. It should be shown only once. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Stories: swiping gesture on stories has to have a shorter activation gesture distance (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3403) - [x] Dialogs: when dialogs open and dim the background, they should also dim the status bar (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3404) - [ ] Profile Page: chat button takes a ridiculous amount of time to load - [x] Profile Page: chat button opens Minds Chat but doesn't open/create with prompt the direct message with that user (https://gitlab.com/minds/chat-android/-/issues/14) - [x] Profile Page: the tip button/icon has a small touchable area. In general icons have to have a larger touchable area than their icon size. This issue is seen throughout the app. including the message icon in profile page, and show more in text contents. (takes some tries to tap correctly) (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3405) - [x] Profile Page: ellipsis action dialog cancel button's bottom margin is too small - [x] Profile Page: Subscribers, subscriptions and views is not in the same line and looks lazy (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3406) - [ ] I think something has to be done about the icons near the profile. Currently they take too much space, reduce the simplicity of the app, are ambiguous for new users (I still don't understand the airplane icon, and actively thought for some time what the plus icon represented which now I know is minds plus. I'm sure this is common knowledge between old minds users though). I'm not saying they have to be removed but I'm also not crossing that possibility off. - [x] Profile Page: Join button is confusing to me. I've so far seen subscribe, follow, and now I see join. I also can't make sense of "join"ing for example Bill Ottman (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3406) - [x] The Select Dialog is .... (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3407) - [x] Join Dialog: When selecting USD, the SELECT CARD select box doesn't have horizontal margins - [x] Join Dialog: Join membership button has to be full-width and centered. It could also be more attractive. - [x] The dollar icon for tipping may need a redesign. I'm thinking tipping is about supporting rather than being about money (which a dollar sign is about). Also showing the tip button with the dollar sign on every post means the user will see the dollar sign a lot. And that unconsciously makes the user think this is all about money (or in other words emphasizes monetary thinking). which is not a helpful mindset for a social media IMO. Also if all posts have a page for themselves, isn't it possible to move the tip button inside the post rather than making it visible on every post? How frequent is tipping? (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3447) - [x] Images: Pan to zoom is essential for any social media with pictures IMO. The view image button in the ellipsis is a hack. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3408) - [x] Images: view image navbar background color is broken. I'm on dark mode on my phone. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3409) - [x] Navbar should hide when the user scrolls down and should appear when the user scrolls up (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3410) - [x] Aren't material icons boring? anyone? I'm thinking about the possibility of doing a custom redesign of important icons (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3447) - [ ] Is there a meaning behind the design of the compose button? I'm just curious - [ ] OPINION: minds plus and minds pro are confusing in regard to branding. They even have the same background image. - [ ] Newsfeed Activity: Ellipsis button and its actiondialog load very slowly - [ ] Newsfeed Activity: name doesn't have touchable feedback - [ ] Bonus: ![image](/uploads/f498b240c07ff09556162633c763c21d/image.png) - [x] The importance of the buttons of like dislike comment etc. are too much for being seen numerous times in the feed. they are too bold. they have to be thinner, accessible, but not in the eye too much. - [x] I tap on a newsfeed post and it opens the stories UI. This is very confusing navigation-wise. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3412) - [x] In the Stories UI, I can see a touchable opacity feedback on texts, but there is no onPress action. And the whole text's opacity is reduced on tap which doesn't look very good. - [ ] Story animation was laggy on my device. Not too much, but noticable. - [x] OPINION: enlarged text when the text content is short is heterogenous with other newsfeed text material and is harder on the eye to read because of larger text (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3413) - [x] Videos: there's a black flash before a video is played which is clunky. especially in Stories (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: the device shouldn't go to sleep when videos are playing (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: the playing video should stay floating around when navigating minds. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Videos: video may keep playing in the background when device is locked. this will make listening to long-form content (podcast, interview, event) far easier. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3449) - [x] Minds Chat: splash screen has UI issues in dark mode (https://gitlab.com/minds/chat-android/-/issues/15) - [x] Camera/compose has to open with animation. It currently has a poor animation and slightly flashes the entire screen white before opening the camera/compose (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3454) - [x] Capture button in camera is grey. It should be an active color like blue. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3454) - [ ] Slide up animation after the app is opened is unnecessary - [ ] I'm confused about the actions of follow and subscribe - [ ] I can't select a portion of the text in posts. I can only copy the entire post. The touchable feedback is also unnecessary - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> subscribe to someone -> the dialog is closed and weird things happen that I don't understand (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3455) - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> unsubscribe from someone -> the dialog is black while the app theme is light (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3424) - [x] Open a story/post -> tap on up-votes -> tap on a profile and go their profile page -> press home button and leave minds -> open minds again -> the upvotes dialog is opened on the profile page (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3456) - [x] Scroll down on main feed -> while scrolling down press on home in tabbar -> the scroll position jumps but the scroll keeps going. What should happen? it should scroll to top with smooth animation and only then start reloading (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3457) - [x] Phone number verification "Send Verification Code" button doesn't have any validation. u can press it while having the phone number field empty and it says verification code sent to +1. The button is also always grey which doesn't make sense. (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/3458) - [ ] Phone number verification: resend code button doesn't tell me to e.g. wait 2 minutes to get another code. but it has a rate limit so I guess that's fine - [ ] JUST WONDERING: Shouldn't the start earning tokens button have a better call to action? shouldn't it be dismissable? - [x] Analytics: the tabs aren't scrollable

title: Investigate the posibility of use MMKV to store offline mode cache
description:
### Summary

Storing offline mode cache in MMKV will increase the write/read performance considerably

The problematic part is to implement some sort of TTL for the cache and old data cleaning

title: Reimplement e2e for user onboarding
description:
Reimplement e2e for user onboarding

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- It could be implemented after the registration in the same

title: Reimplement e2e for register
description:
Reimplement e2e for user registration

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- Register a new user
- Go to settings and delete it
- Check the possibility of using a dummy database

title: Reimplement e2e for new posts for the composer screen
description:
### Summary
Refactor /e2e/posts.spect.js to /e2e/posts.e2e.js

- Use device.reloadReactNative instead of app launch in the beforeEach callback (faster)
- Use the login action 
- Create tests for: Text only post, NSFW with text, attached image post, check more variants needed (we should test all the composer features)

title: Unable to scroll comments
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Member reports being unable to scroll their comments 
https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1258815431945248768

### Steps to reproduce

The user can replicate from any comments on-site

### Platform information 

Latest app. Android 6.0.1, huawei honor 5x

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Member cannot scroll comments at all

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Member should be able to scroll comments.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1258815431945248768

### Possible fixes

Our mobile team have changed nothing that should cause an effect like this - immediate suspicion was that it could be something to do with the older Android 6.0.0 OS but that doesn't seem to be affecting a Browserstack Galaxy S7 (Android 6) that I tested with.

![image](/uploads/b71564725018618918cd38d7fda31b12/image.png)

title: Align iOS keyboard theme with the system
description:
When accessing a keyboard from any app on my phone, the keyboard theme reflects the system theme. In my case, 'Dark Mode'.

Is it possible to update the Minds App so the system theme and internal keyboards within the app match? All keyboard instances in Minds seem to be always displayed in Light mode.

![IMG_3360](/uploads/582a1567510f595ecc59ea6c7fc7ae96/IMG_3360.PNG)

cc @msantang78

title: Implement improved actionsheet designs
description:
The current implementation of action sheets varies somewhat from screen to screen. Some screens use a native implementation, whereas others use custom styling.

In an attempt to streamline UI assets and make the overall UX more predictable, we should consolidate all action sheets, to use a single and improved design. In addition, action sheet functionality could be extended to cover select/dropdown controls.

The following areas in the mobile application should be addressed.


### Comments

- [x] Comments (tapping on a comment ellipsis, on a post authored by the current user) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/l1Qrbw7
- [x] Comments (tapping comment ellipsis as a comment owner) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/v81x8KM
- [x] Create comment (tapping on the ellipsis relative to the add comment component) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/4aE9axd

### Newsfeed

- [x] Post (viewer) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/l1rqOnd
- [x] Post (owner) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/agbk4mz
- [x] Filter feed (channel) - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/VrvZ3Do
- [x] Remind/quote post - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/paA9vWQ

### Wallet

- [x] Filter transactions - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/kaLrg8l (TBD how date range selection would function here - could be omitted if proving too complicated)
- [x] Wallet balance ellipsis - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/oYL1ag0


### Channels
- [x] General channel ellipsis - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/agbqD9z

### Other
* Light mode example - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/xr2yJJV

### Structure
You can see attached the building blocks of a action sheet here. https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/52AYxGx

### Animation
See example animation using the following framer URL -> https://framer.com/share/Mobile-Navigation-Minds-iOS--ogwGjNnMFrUaSpljQJ2A/q0H8kNRcv?editor=1

### Notes
We would in the future like to be able to use the action sheet concept to communicate important user messages. For example, notices such as 'Upgrade to Minds+', 'Setup your wallet' or 'Download chat'. See -> https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/1KLGyQp - https://www.sketch.com/s/ed8346e7-232d-4278-9fdf-aefbb31c1f30/a/1KLGyQp - We're not in a position to implement this now, but is possibly worth considering at this point.

Once we're happy with the above proposition, I'll remove the WIP tag from this issue.

cc: @ottman @jotto141 @rcaferati @msantang78 @juanmsolaro

title: (chore) bump version 3.10.1
Enforce the VOTE permission
description: Non banned, logged in users who can see the activity should be able to vote on it

title: Enforce the VIEW permission
description:
Admins, Owners, channel owners, channel admins, channel moderators, group owners, group admins, group moderators and subscribers can view entities belonging to closed channels and private groups

Anyone who is not banned can see entities belonging to open and moderated channels and public groups

All entities that do not have a VIEW permission should be denied

title: Enforce the WIRE permission
description: Only logged in and not banned users can wire other users

title: Enforce the REMIND permission
description:
For open content, anyone who can view it can remind it

For closed channels, moderated channels and private groups, only subscribers can remind

title: Enforce the TAG permission
description:
Only logged in, not banned users should be able to tag activities

Only subscribers to moderated and closed channels can tag activities belong to those groups

Only subscribers to private groups can tag activities

title: Enforce the SUBSCRIBE permission for channels
description:
Open channels should be able to be subscribed to
Moderated channels should be able to be requested for approval
Closed channels should be invite only

title: Enforce the MESSAGE permission
description: Only logged in / non-banned users should be able to message other users

title: Enforce the JOIN_GATHERING permissions on groups
description: Only admins, owners, group admins and moderators should be able to join gatherings

title: Enforce the JOIN permission on groups
description: Logged in, not banned users should be able to join a public group

title: Enforce the JOIN permission on channels
description: Logged in, not banned users should be able to join an open channel

title: Enforce the INVITE permission on groups
description:
Admins, owners, group admins, moderator and subscribers can invite users to open and private groups

Public group automatically accepts, private groups need to be approved

title: Enforce the INVITE permission on channels
description:
Admins, owners, channel admins, moderator and subscribers can invite users to open, moderated and closed channels

Open channels are automatically accepts, moderated and closed need to be approved

title: Enforce the EDIT_COMMENT permission
description: Only the owner of a comment should be able to edit it

title: Enforce the EDIT_CHANNEL permission
description: Admins, channel owners and channel admins should be able to edit the channel

title: Enforce the CREATE_CHANNEL permission
description: Anyone who is logged in and not banned should be able to create a channel

title: Enforce APPROVE_SUBSCRIBER permission flag for groups
description: Admins, group owners, group admins and group moderators should be able to accept and reject subscribers for their group

title: Enforce the APPOINT_MODERATOR flag for groups
description: Admins, group owners and group admins should be able to appoint users to group moderators

title: Enforce the APPOINT_MODERATOR flag for channels
description: Admins, channel owners and channel admins should be able to appoint users to channel moderators

title: Sometimes boosts are not injected in the first pages of the main feed
Enforce the APPOINT_ADMIN flag
description:
Admins should be able to make other users admins

Create a new dropdown menu option on a user to appoint admin if the user is an admin

title: Design and Implement a permissions service
Enforce CREATE_GROUP permission flag
description: Logged in users of all roles should have the ability to create a group. This should just be a replacement check for the existing add group functionality

title: Enforce APPROVE_SUBSCRIBER permission flag for channels
description: Moderated and closed channels and closed groups need to approve subscription requests

title: Enforce CREATE_COMMENT permission flag
description:
Users can only create comments when their permissions role returns the CREATE_COMMENT flag

This will be: Activities they own Open Channels Open Groups Moderated channels they are subscribed to Closed channels they are subscribed to Moderated groups they are subscribed to Closed groups they are subscribed to

title: (feature) Enable channel owners and admins to appoint new admins and moderators
description:
Channels need the ability to mark users as admins, moderators

Using the new permission scheme, roles with the ability to APPOINT_ADMIN and APPOINT_MODERATOR need to be able to select them on the channel subscribers page

title: (feature) replace admin check with permissions
description: Everywhere we check for admin permissions, we need to put in a feature flag (permissions) check that asks for the new flag

title: Create a UI for accepting or denying subscription requests
description:
For channel owners, they should have a new sidebar section for accepting subscription requests

Display a list of pending channel subscriptions Accept button posts to /api/v2/permissions/channels/{channel guid}/{subscriber guid} Reject button deletes to /api/v2/permissions/channels/{channel guid}/{subscriber guid}

title: Deny access to closed channels
description: When a user requests an entity or channel that is marked closed, that they are not subscribed too and that the channel owner has not accepted, we must display a "This is a closed channel" error.

title: Enable marking a channel closed or open
(chore) code clean up for offline-first
(feat) Allow enabling and disabling of comments on blogs
description:
https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/issues/1044

On the meatball menu, add a new option to "Allow Comments" and "Disable Comments"

Call the POST ```api/v2/permissions/comments/{guid}``` endpoint 
with 
```
{ allowed: true | false }
```

implemented in https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/issues/526

Note the api endpoint handles updating the activity associated with the blog

Entities coming from engine will have an allow_comments attribute set to true or false

If an blog has no comments, change the comment button to the speaker notes off icon
https://material.io/tools/icons/?icon=speaker_notes_off&style=baseline
and disabled grey. Disable comment inputs

If an blog has comments, change the comment to the speaker notes off icon 
https://material.io/tools/icons/?icon=speaker_notes_off&style=baseline
and active blue. Disable comment inputs but still show replies and reply counts

title: (feat) Allow enabling and disabling of comments on activities
description:
On the meatball menu, add a new option to "Allow Comments" and "Disable Comments"

Call the POST ```api/v2/permissions/comments/{guid}``` endpoint 
with 
```
{ allowed: true | false }
```

implemented in https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/issues/526

Note the api endpoint will handle assigning the permission to attachments associated with the activity

Entities coming from engine will have an allow_comments attribute set to true or false

If an activity has no comments, change the comment button to the speaker notes off icon
https://material.io/tools/icons/?icon=speaker_notes_off&style=baseline
and disabled grey. Disable comment inputs

If an activity has comments, change the comment to the speaker notes off icon

title: Improve the style system and clean up old ones
description:
### Summary

Following the idea of this MR https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1267 of generating the styles dynamically. 

- [x] Move current spacing to an on-demand dynamic approach
- [x] Move current colors to an on-demand dynamic approach
- [x] Move current sizes to an on-demand dynamic approach
- [x] Move current borders to an on-demand dynamic approach
- [x] Change name convention for colors
- [x] Remove old hard coded styles and replace them with the dynamics
- [x] Implement dynamic types to validate styles
- [x] Clean up old styling system and colors

title: Show a list of who has voted on a post
description:
- Above the thumbs up and down icons, show a preview of icons of users who have voted on the post
- As we currently merge the remind votes, if the count of votes is higher than our list of users, show '+ x more' line
- [ ] Ensure this is efficient and well cached

Updated requirements:
* [ ]  Use api/v3 endpoint
  * See: https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/blob/master/Core/Votes/Indexes.php#L97
  * See: https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/blob/master/Core/DismissibleWidgets/Controllers.php
  * See: https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/blob/master/Core/DismissibleWidgets/Routes.php
* [ ]  Have the # of votes next to thumb icons click to a modal with a list of voters
* [ ]  At the bottom of the modal, if total votes is higher than users, show "+ X more"
* [ ]  Implement for mobile

Mockup https://www.sketch.com/s/badfc17f-50ab-4add-86e0-a003c11a4b30/a/VyQEAo/play

title: Notification permission prompt on iOS
description:
The notification permission prompt - except on a few corner cases - gets significantly stronger results when the user had already invested some time/effort into the application. Placing it after the login and not as the first interaction presented by the app would be a better strategy.

- [ ] Move the notification prompt to an after the login event / newsfeed screen

![Simulator_Screen_Shot_-_iPhone_12_-_2021-05-12_at_18.16](/uploads/c7c6a9c5bf92acd2b3569f3bb578b37d/Simulator_Screen_Shot_-_iPhone_12_-_2021-05-12_at_18.16.png)

title: Wallet inner tabs hard-scroll on select
description:
This happens on Android and iOS. After scrolling, when selecting any of the tabs the container hard-scrolls to the `0` position. The main issue is when you select an item that is outside the viewport as it's not shown on the screen it's selected. (watch video)


![RPReplay_Final1621546439](/uploads/e8e68c92729f1c389351319d78ab7cb7/RPReplay_Final1621546439.MOV)

title: Wallet bottom sheet wrongfully positioned after animation
description:
The Wallet's `bottomStore` is getting wrongfully positioned on Android and iOS. It animates with a 30pt gap between the sheet and the bottom tabs.

Not sure if the component is currently been used elsewhere but it seems to be present just on the wallet and phone validation.

![wallet](/uploads/4dbb760b16395c14e9df053f1fb5b21c/wallet.png)

title: Missing EN translation on the onboarding screen
description:
Missing `en.onboarding.hidePanel` translation on the onboarding screen ActionSheet.



![IMG_7484](/uploads/aba1ce563b2bd78585bc4ef94a8d20ef/IMG_7484.png)

title: Minds+ subscription on iOS
description:
**Issue:**
Keeping the Lifetime membership as the only option can easily send the message to a new iOS user that the only way for joining Minds+ would be by acquiring 2500 MINDS. Considering the ~10 to 1 revenue gap between iOS and Android users this could be an interesting opportunity to be explored.

- Gathering data on what has already been done - iOS review/guideline wise - and what's the mindset behind leaving just the lifetime option.
- Considering Apple's review guidelines using a copy on the lines of "Learn more about how to unlock the powers of Minds+" - with/without an action button linking to the browser - could be an alternate quick-change.

Further discussion regarding the use of Apple's IAP could be considered. If possible - mainly privacy wise - using a 3rd party service like [revenuecat](https://revenuecat.com) can be an option for accelerating the development process and quickly validate the use of Apple's subscription tied with Mind's payment services.

![IMG_7113_3](/uploads/706b0fbffcbe155c8af111e206fdc3e9/IMG_7113_3.png)

title: Review main feed custom action sheet
description:
On all feed activity cards the action sheet is using a `ActionSheetCustom` from `react-native-actionsheet`. That's rendering a non-native alternative that animates without the native-driver turned on - dropping too many frames on the animation - and that doesn't recognize iOS's safe insets.

- [ ] Change `ActionSheetCustom` to the default `ActionSheet` from the same lib - which uses a native ui component - on all instances that it's being currently used.

* Evaluate the Android counterpart. Using the default one will render a really similar actionsheet to the one that's currently been customized.

Although the ActionSheet's gonna be replaced later, this is a lightweight quick-fix that impacts all listing cards extra actions.

Platform: iOS/Android

![IMG_7501](/uploads/bc56bbfc1508854e32998cbe37001de8/IMG_7501.png)

title: All top bar tabs are not scrolling horizontally on content overflow
description:
The top bar tabs are not horizontally scrollable. This issue can be seen on the Analytics (en) screen but depending on the user's language it affects every screen that has the tab component (discovery included).

- [x] Review the tab bar component adding the horizontal scroll behavior when the content overflows the parent container

![IMG_7524](/uploads/8a490b8211d676cb8a34589e9f070670/IMG_7524.png)

title: Comments multiple UX issues (action, auto-scroll, load more, validation)
description:
The general UX behavior of the comments bottom sheet is off. If it turns out to be a large chunk of work it should be aligned with the new navigation restructure to avoid re-working it.

Probably the easiest way of quick-fixing it would be avoiding the scroll-to-bottom behavior and inverting the comment list. The infinite loading more and the dismiss on scroll would become smaller issues then.

- [ ] When auto-scrolling to the bottom of the sheet the message composer isn't visible
- [ ] When the user does a hard scroll-up the whole sheet is dismissed
- [ ] There's no validation to avoid sending empty strings on the composer
- [ ] The composer itself is unaware of the safe area insets
- [ ] The scroll list is unaware of the safe area insets

Platform: iOS.

![IMG_7774](/uploads/fc8ddc5dba68890488cddb3dff948006/IMG_7774.png)

title: Delete account button showing white-on-white on dark mode
description:
The button on the delete account screen is showing a white on white color scheme.

Platform: iOS - on Dark Mode.

- [ ] Change the button's scheme
- [ ] Check if the same behavior happens elsewhere

![IMG_7115_3](/uploads/c71d4b7eebad8d3c6a2a1ac8a3a236ab/IMG_7115_3.png)

title: Disable media post editing
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Reported by @ChrisDoogood

We need to match the front-end for web and not allow members to edit media attachments in posts.
This is because it causes major issues behind the scenes; one example problem is that on image change, all previous interaction is lost, presumably this happens for video also.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Make a post with an image.
2. Comment on the post.
3. Edit the image.
4. Note your comment is gone.

### Platform information 

Reported iOS, replicated Android (S10) likely platform agnostic.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

User can edit their image post so there are many things that break when they do this.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Disable editing of already posted images and videos.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Share post via chat
description:
See click-through here -> https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/DPdZdpy/play

* A new share icon is added to each post (https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/DPdZdpy)
* When tapped the user may either, `Send to` or `Share` - Clicking `share` launches the existing native share drawer (currently access via the ellipsis - note the ellipsis share option should be removed). Clicking `send to` launches a new drawer as shown here https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/dlkMbvZ
* The most recent chat activity is display in chronological order.
* The user may search channels https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/g0ARq3g - the exact search logic is undefined, but we should be giving greater weight to channels we follow / follow us, channels with recent chat activity.
* The user may share only with one group/channel at a time. https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/DPdZYd4
* When an individual or group is not selected, the send button is disabled.
* Only when a single group or channel is selected does the send button become activated.
* When a channel / group is selected, a blue tick will confirm the selection https://www.sketch.com/s/68237c3e-39a3-484d-9dce-3e7bde06d600/a/DPdZYd4
* Tapping on an already selected channel/group will deselect it.
* Ideally the send action can be completed from within the main Minds App - although in all likelihood this may need to be done within the chat app.

cc @ottman @msantang78

title: Add observables within channel
description:
This relates to https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1179 and follows on from our conversation on Monday @msantang78 

Two small additions should be made to the above MR

- Make channel bio an observable, so when a bio is updated via channel settings, it's reflected immediately within with the about tab. Currently used has to navigate away, and then back to the about tab for the newly updated bio to be reflected.
- Make feed list an observable within a channel feed. After a new post is created from within a user's channel, it should appear immediately within the feed. i.e. the user should not need to pull to refresh to see their new post

I'll keep the above MR labeled as a WIP until the above two actions are completed.

cc @msantang78 @juanmsolaro

title: Password manager testing on login / register forms
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

I've had a couple of users report this. For me, my password manager 1Password does not show up at all on the login form.
I suspect there may be issues with other managers too so I'd probably test some of the most common if possible (LastPass, Bitwarden).

Though my issue is login we should also double-check that registration picks up the password generators correctly.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open app from logged out state.
2. No password manager prompt appears.

### Platform information 

* **My device**: Galaxy S10, Android 11, App v4.9.1 
* **A member (\@devonmcpherson)** reports similar issues with an iPhone 12 Pro ios 14.4 

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

No password manager prompt appears.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Password manager prompts should appear on login and register.

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The email deep link for stripe restricted campaign is not working correctly.

### Steps to reproduce

Follow the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta) which should open the Wallet screen with correct bank account settings. 

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?


When following the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta), it will open the Wallet screen with incorrect bank account settings. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

When following the [link](https://email.minds.com/wallet/cash/settings?__e_ct_guid=100000000000000063&campaign=when&topic=channel_improvement_tips&state=new&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=stripe_is_restricted&utm_source=manual&utm_content=cta), it will open the Wallet screen with correct bank account settings. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Create UI entry point for in-app user verification
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Create the UI entry point in the home screen for in-app user verification.

## What needs to be done

- create a widget in the in-app user verification module, which will be displayed in the home screen between the ,, and the news feed, as per [UI design](https://www.figma.com/file/buCViQPMNyQUNCdtDYUTbL/In-App-User-Verification?node-id=308%3A1321&t=I7n8h64U4ZiemLJt-0)
- create a screen in the in-app user verification module, to navigate from the widget as per the U design
- link the in-app verification process initiation with the continue button of the above screen

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

https://www.figma.com/file/buCViQPMNyQUNCdtDYUTbL/In-App-User-Verification?node-id=314%3A1541&t=I7n8h64U4ZiemLJt-0

## Personas

Developers

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

AC1:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] WHEN I navigate to home screen
- [ ] THEN I will see a widget prompting for in-app verification 

AC2:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am a verified user
- [ ] WHEN I navigate to home screen
- [ ] THEN I will not see the widget prompting for in-app verification 

AC3:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I navigate to home screen 
- [ ] AND I see the widget prompting for in-app verification 
- [ ] WHEN I press on the Verify button
- [ ] THEN I will navigate to the Verify Channel screen 

AC4:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] AND the `I agree to Terms` checkbox is off
- [ ] THEN the `Continue` button on the top-right is disabled

AC5:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] WHEN I check the `I agree to Terms` checkbox (on)
- [ ] THEN the `Continue` button on the top-right will be enabled

AC6:
- [ ] GIVEN that I am an unverified user
- [ ] AND I an in the Verify Channel screen
- [ ] AND the `I agree to Terms` checkbox is no
- [ ] WHEN I press the `Continue` button on the top-right 
- [ ] THEN I navigate to the in-app verification initiation process screen


## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Supermind settings minimum values should be pulled from config
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Min Supermind values aren't taken from config in Supermind settings - this means that now the engine is being updated for https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/merge_requests/1188, mobile does not reflect these changes (see screenshot)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Point at either the branch for https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/merge_requests/1188 or whatever env that change is released to.
2. Go to Supermind settings and try to set a value of 1 for cash. 

### Platform information 

Mobile

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Shows a $10 min when config states it should be 2.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should update based upon config.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/88db2534c2f40a05c3a87921a7f1ff48/image.png)

### Possible fixes

It appears to be hardcoded here:

https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/blob/f598d0419d482d58867a085fd33f316db481e089/src/settings/screens/SupermindSettingsScreen.tsx#L144

Value can be grabbed from https://www.minds.com/api/v1/minds/config (upermind.min_thresholds.min_cash / min_usd)

![image](/uploads/0f3ea9ed2a64d2510833c58a5058737c/image.png)

description:
### Summary

Error message should be clear that you need to upload an image or a video when accepting a supermind offer that expects an image or a video. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Login as user1. 
2. Send a supermind offer with image/video reply to user2. 
3. Login as user2.
4. Accept the offer.
5. Do not add image/video in supermind reply.
6. Press send.
7. Error message appears that is not descriptive. 

### Platform information 

4.30 RC - Browserstack S22

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Error message is not clearly explaining why supermind is not working. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Error message should be clear as in web. Please follow similar text as web. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/55c5abef9d9ac021ecc7d7fc127b05a2/image.png)

title: Cancel button is getting truncated for Superminds
description:
### Summary

Cancel button is not visible on superminds confirmation modals. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open app. 
2. Login as a user and send superminds. 
3. On confirm modal, notice cancel button truncated. 
4. Same issue when accepting a superminds. 

### Platform information 

Browserstack 4.30 RC - S22

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Cancel button is truncated

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Cancel button should be visible. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/1c68ce05fc1705eb9f6a3c62865004f4/image.png)

![image](/uploads/ed160a0ca7ed6d70a0e7a9a3f2a9ab97/image.png)

title: Remove android install permission from the play store build
description:
## Goal

We need to remove the REQUEST_INSTALL_PACKAGES permission for the play store build in order to avoid complaints.


## What needs to be done

Remove the permission only for the play store build. We still need the permission for the full android version (used in the auto-update)

## QA

-


## UX/Design

-


## Acceptance Criteria

title: Replace setInterval with user events for onboarding updates
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Improve performance by removing `setInterval` when checking for onboarding update.

## What needs to be done

Test the clearance of the `setInterval` on the both platforms (real devices) and confirm it's happening every time we navigate away from the screen or bring the app in sleep mode. On failure replace `setInterval` with other appropriate events to check for onboarding update using setTimeout with most conservative delay.

description:

title: Deleting / deactivating account does not log user out
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Deleting the only account in the app, does not log user out

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create an account or have an account you can mess with
2. Delete or deactivate the account
3. Notice that you end up on account switching screen, but cannot log out, can scroll minds, but can not interact (essentially read only mode)


### Platform information

- tested Google pixel 6 pro, android 13
- iphone xr
- honor 9

### App version

- 4.29.0
- 4.30.1 (deletion) honor9
- 4.30.2 (deactivation) iphone XR

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

User not logged out when they delete / deactivate account

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- User should get to the "please log in" screen after deleting / deactivating account if it's only account
- User should get the username removed from account switcher after deleting / deactivating account if it's multiple accounts

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Saved card won't activate unless clicked
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Saved card won't activate unless clicked (Video recording / image bellow)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Have a card saved on your account, ready to pay for stuff
2. Try setting up supermind, or sending a wire
3. Notice you get an error message your supermind / wire could not be send
4. Click the card field, and select card
5. Notice that you can now create supermind / wire

### Platform information 

Mobile app, Android, Honor 9

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Need to select card before sending supermind / wire

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

If card is set up on account, it should be automatically selected.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Supermind video replies not working on ios
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When responding to a Supermind video reply on the mobile app, if you attempt to record the video directly from the Minds composer, it returns an error when you try to post the video.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Send a video reply supermind to a channel you own
2. Reply to the supermind offer on the mobile app
3. Capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
4. Try to post the reply and you get an error

### Platform information 

iOS.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- GIVEN THAT I reply to a supermind offer
- AND I capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
- AND I try to post the reply
- THEN the video in the reply cannot be played

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- GIVEN THAT I reply to a supermind offer
- AND I capture a video directly using the recording tool in the composer
- AND I post the reply
- THEN the video in the reply should play correctly

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/df80ed44655ddf5256300b2434df2ab4/image.png)

### Possible fixes

It only happens with supermind, so i think the supermind logic does not think the video is there if its recorded directly in the app
aka you can record and post a video in the composer from regular composer.
