title: Change compose to create and add drawer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Minimize friction for users to create and monetize our products. 

<details><summary>Inspiration</summary>



![sc](/uploads/0df8cc4c4c0c207e02625656c6945a8f/sc.jpeg)

![Screenshot_20221101-215006_Twitter](/uploads/b98d066c58af7774b55234561b219e8a/Screenshot_20221101-215006_Twitter.jpg)

![Screenshot_20221101-214808_YouTube](/uploads/5e93ff3a135cdbefe6c4e7b526a2a266/Screenshot_20221101-214808_YouTube.jpg)

</details>

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- Change Compose to Create
- Spawn drawer component which lets a user select: Post, Monetized Post, Boost, Supermind, Story, Group, Photo, Video, Gif, Blog, Membership


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

Create modal

![Screenshot_1677839805](/uploads/3140155f13a58c3b443b535b2594e011/Screenshot_1677839805.png)

Composer

![Screenshot_1677839927](/uploads/50c8c51bf441974d9f18fd3fac4896dc/Screenshot_1677839927.png)

Audience selector

![Screenshot_1677839863](/uploads/b3dba98c9a01a4ed6746bd17228bfd61/Screenshot_1677839863.png)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- Given I'm composing the first time
  - When I press the [+] tab
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And a text hint saying I can long-press on compose button to get this popup
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - When I Long Press the [+] tab
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - When I press the [+] tab
  - Then I see the post composer (as of now)
  - And I can see the caret down next to New Post in the title
  - And I can create a new post

- Given I'm NOT composing for the first time
  - And I press the [+] tab
  - And I see the post composer open
  - When I tap on the caret down next to New Post in the title
  - Then I see a bottom sheet popup with multiple composing options
  - And I can press on any of them

- Given I'm composing a post
  - When I press the "Public" button next to the send button
  - I will see the audience selector

- Given I'm composing a post
  - When open the audience selector
  - Then I will see the "Public" option which will create a normal post
  - And I will see a minds+ option on Android

- Given I'm composing a post as a non-plus user
  - When I open audience selector
  - And I press minds+
  - Then I will be prompted to upgrade to minds plus
  - And when I finish upgrading
  - Then I will see a terms and agreements sheet
  - When I press "I agree to the terms"
  - Then minds+ will be selected
  - And When I press "Done"
  - And I submit the post
  - Then the post will be minds+

- Same AC as above but with a plus user should not upgrade to prompt but should show the terms and agreements

- Given I'm composing a post as a new user
  - When I open audience selector
  - I will see a short description of memberships and how it can be useful to me
  - When I press "Get started"
  - Then I will be able to create a membership and go back and select that membership
  - And I create the post
  - And that post will be in that membership

- Same AC as above but with a user with existing memberships should just show the memberships without prompting to create a new one. It should also have a "manage" button that allows the user to manage their memberships.

- Given I'm composing a post as a user who is a member of one or more groups 
  - When I open audience selector
  - Then I should see all the groups I'm a member of
  - And I should be able to select any of them
  - And post to that group

- Same AC as above but if the user is not a member of a group, they will see no option

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the "Post" option
  - Then the composer opens normally

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Monetized post option (available only on android)
  - Then I will see the composer and the audience selector open at the same time
  - And the audience selector only has Memberships and Minds+ options available

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Boosted post
  - Then composer opens normally
  - When I create a post
  - Then I will see the Boost screen open (animation: slide-from-right)
  - And I can successfully boost that post
  - If I close the Boost screen, then I should not see the composer

- Given I'm composing for the first time and I see the Create modal
  - When I select the Supermind option
  - Then the composer and supermind composer open together and I will be able to create a supermind request
  - and post will be created accordingly, successfully

- All of the above actions related to Create modal should also work from within the composer 

- Given the experiment is off, I should see the normal composer without these features

- Given the experiment is on, I should NOT see the monetize option in the composer poster options
- **Debatable**: Given the experiment is on, I should NOT see the supermind icon in the composer bottom bar

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Prompt users to connect a bank account when accepting cash Supermind offer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

As Minds, I want to send cash Supermind offers to creators, regardless of whether or not they've previously connected a bank account.

As a user, I want to accept a cash Supermind offer and collect the offer.

## What needs to be done

Handle cash Supermind offer charges when the recipient has not already connected a bank account. https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/3409

Add a step into the Supermind reply flow when the offer is for cash and the recipient has not previously connected to a bank account.

1. View Supermind console
2. Click accept on a cash offer
3. `New`: Prompt to connect a bank account
4. On connect, open the stripe web page in internal browser and complete enrollment
4. On success, compose the reply
5. On failure to connect prompt again

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

In the Supermind console, show a toast message when a user attempts to accept a cash Supermind offer and they have not yet connected their account:

> `To accept this offer, you must first add your bank information.`

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Given a recipient has not previously connected a bank account, and they've received a cash Supermind offer, when they click to accept the offer, then they are prompted to connect their bank account via toast error message
- [ ] Given the Stripe connect account has been connected, then the recipient can continue to compose a Supermind reply.
- [ ] Given that the user has no connected bank account, then open the stripe web page in internal browser
- [ ] Given that the user complete the connected bank account in stripe web site, then he can dismiss the browser and continue to compose Supermind
- [ ] Given that the user does not complete the connected bank account in stripe web site, when he dismiss the browser then he'll be prompted to add a new bank account.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

## Goal

The screen will have a guidance on the preferred area to fit the written code.

related to https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4472

- Add support for bottom area for instructions and messages and action button

As per UIb

title: UX: in-app user verification - UI Screens
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Implement the in-app mobile phone user verification 

## What needs to be done

1. User requests registration in the user interface
2. Simulate API call to check if user was verified and render alert component
3. Application verifies that it is not running in an emulator and that the device has a camera and gyro/accelerator sensors
4. Application opens a modal that explains the process
5. User agrees to terms and requests a registration code
6. Add all behind a feature flag

Note: the widget will open a new module navigator with its own stack.

## QA

As per screenshots

## UX/Design

title: Add visual confirmation on code-push update
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Check for code-push updates and add a visual confirmation in a bottom sheet to download, install and restart the app.

## What needs to be done

- automatically download any updates from the prod channel
- add a code-push check for updates on focus in home screen
- show a banner between the moments and the last posts popping up a confirmation bottom-sheet with text to download an update
- install and restart the app on confirmation

## QA

N/A

## UX/Design

Need to get the confirmation text.

## Acceptance Criteria
1. 
- GIVEN that I go to home screen
- AND the code-push check for updates returns true
- THEN I see a top banner with install now message
2.
- GIVEN that I see the code-push top banner confirmation
- WHEN I press on install now
- THEN the code-push update will be downloaded and installed 
- AND the app will restart
3.
~~- GIVEN that I see the code-push bottom-sheet confirmation~~

~~- WHEN I press on NO button~~

~~- THEN the top widget confirmation popup will hide~~

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Add staging code-push support in DevTools screen
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Add toggle in developer menu to switch between production and staging code-push keys. Both keys pairs will be provided in the env file.

## What needs to be done

- Add toggle component in developer menu to change code-push channel
- On toggle to staging channel, download, install and restart the app if any present code-push

## QA

No need a new build for iOS and Android to test the channel switch.

## UX/Design

Add new item in the DevTools screen with either a toggle switch component or a check to mark the staging channel selection.

## Acceptance Criteria

- GIVEN that I'm in the DevTools screen
- WHEN I press on the line item with the staging code-push
- THEN the app will download and install the update
- AND the app will restart
- AND the changes will be present in the app

Both

title: Console should show pending/accepted Supermind offers first in the console and then sort by date (app)
description:

The console currently shows all the offers only sorted by date.

title: In-feed notice for pending Supermind offers (app)
description:
## Goal

Increase the acceptance rate for Supermind offers.

## What needs to be done

Implement a new in-feed notice that prompts a user with pending Supermind offers to act on those offers.

| Notice                    | Description                                                                   | Dismissable | Position | Sticky | Display priority | Conditions                          | Primary action                                   | Secondary action |
|---------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------|----------|--------|------------------|-------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------|------------------|
| You have Supermind offers | Reply to your fans to claim cash or tokens before your pending offers expire. | No          | Top      | No     | 1.1              | User has pending Supermind offer(s) | Let's go (clicks to Supermind console > Inbound) | n/a              |

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

n/a

## Personas

Creators

## Experiments

n/a

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Given a user has pending Supermind offers, and they've already confirmed their email address, when they visit the Newsfeed, then an in-feed notice informs them of their pending offers.
- [ ] The in-feed notice displays the total value of their pending Supermind offers.
- [ ] Clicking the `Let's go` button directs the user to the Supermind console > Inbound tab.
- [ ] Track click events on Snowflake

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Superminds replies and reminds are not throwing the correct toaster message
description:
### Summary

Supermind replies and remind toasters say supermind request has been sent successfully. The toaster message should be updated when reminding or replying to a supermind post. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds app.
2. Send a supermind post to a user.
3. Login with other use and reply to that supermind post. 
4. Reply/Remind a supermind post. 

### Platform information 

All platforms - 4.29.1 RC

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

After replying or reminding a supermind post, the toaster message does not say you replied or reminded. Instead says that your supermind request was sent. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Supermind toaster message should be correct. 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/61983f8523330e474320e1f17094d210/image.png)
![image](/uploads/227d125180d77e04c1da37f7a701bcb4/image.png)

title: Chore: Fix all unguarded route.params occurrences across entire code-base
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Fix all unguarded route.params occurrences across entire code-base.

## What needs to be done

Search all occurrences of the `route.params.` and replace them with `route.params?.` where applicable.

Some cases: `route.params.store, route.params.entity, route.params.comment, route.params.open, route.params.options, route.params.useForSelection, route.params.query, route.params.f, route.params.plus, route.params.group, route.params.source, route.params.noBottomInset, route.params.guid, route.params.index, route.params.goBack`

Require complete testing.

title: Improve component recycling by media type
description:
## Goal

Improve performance and memory usage with the new recycler list by reusing the Activity components grouped by media type.

The first implementation just reuses the activity component for all posts, this will create and destroy Images and Video players depending on the post type. If we set the type by media, all posts with videos will be rendered using the same instances, reducing the creation and destruction of video players.

## What needs to be done

Redefine the FeedList's getType by activity media type

## QA

Videos should work as usual


## UX/Design

none

none

title: Video component issues with new recycle feed
description:
### Summary

The MindsVideo component doesn't support recycling. It has stable references to the entity passed so it doesn't change.

When an instance is recycled and rendered with other properties it plays the original video instead of the new one.

We need to refactor it to allow changing the entity and resetting all the video player properties and preloading.

### Steps to reproduce

### Platform information 
Both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Repeated videos on the feed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The component should render the new video

n/a

title: Build console to manage Superminds
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
- Create management console for users to easily accept and respond to Supermind requests or reject them


## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

*Note: All design links below refer to the web UI.*

**[Supermind Console Prototype](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=1045%3A20853&viewport=4819%2C-9298%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=1045%3A20853)**

* The SuperMind (console) is accessible via the `More Menu` within the main navigation.
* Users will also be directed here from email and push notifications.
* This SuperMind console is separate from the Boost console.
  * This console displays only the incoming requests [Requests received](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=319%3A12073)
  * And outgoing requests [Requests sent](https://www.figma.com/file/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?node-id=338%3A12739)
* The settings icon contained within the above designs will link directly to the SuperMind settings (within the Settings Area).

**Requests Received**

* A user may either reply to a request, or choose to reject it.
* A producer has \[72 hours\] to respond to a request.
* Any expired request will disappear from `Requests Received`
* Requests are ordered from new -> old.
* Each request will also display any meta data relevant to the request.
  * Offer amount
  * Twitter post
  * Content type: Text, Video, Image, Remind.
* If the user clicks reject, funds are refunded to the consumer and a notification sent (As detailed within notification)
* Where the user clicks reply, the composer is launched.
  * Note: If the is the users first-time replying to a SuperMind request, they will need to read and agree to the relevant terms of user.
  * After doing so, they’ll then be directed to the composer.
  * If there’s there are specific content requirements, this could be communicated within the placeholder copy. (e.g. video required).
* Workflow for the above detailed here -> [Accept request workflow with T&Cs](https://www.figma.com/proto/thrGepQAxmcMGB7MoEEckM/Supermind?page-id=287%3A5127&node-id=319%3A12073&viewport=857%2C575%2C0.13&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=319%3A12073)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

title: Allow decimal in subscriber counts
description:
### Summary

Currently, if you have 1100 subscribers, it will read 1k subscribers - I believe this happens until you reach 1500, which makes it read 2k (looking at existing examples).

It would be good if we could show this as 1.1k - at least in the lower thousands.

### Steps to reproduce

See a channel such as https://www.minds.com/bitman007
That has subscribers in the low thousands.

### Platform information 

Likely platform-agnostic, happening on the front-end.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

We don't provide much definition on how many subs a user has when they first enter the thousands.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Up for discussion. On the "about" page it shows the actual number - but on the user's channel, it doesn't. I personally think it should probably be to  1 decimal place - 1.1k / 1.2k up to 10000.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

Check front task https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/issues/4792

### Possible fixes

title: Mobile Automation: Add Profile test cases
Use Friendly Captcha to detect spam votes
description:
## Goal

This change is aimed at reducing the volume of spam votes on Minds.

## What needs to be done

Execute Friendly Captcha for all engagements that contribute to Engagement scores. (Currently, I think that's just upvotes.)

The Friendly Captcha should execute in the background, and not require the user to click anything to execute beyond the initial engagement click.

If a Friendly Captcha fails, display a toaster message to the user communicating that their engagement looks like spam.



- In order to implement this task it will be necessary to find a way to use the JS part of the friendly captcha and remove the need for the webview


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

(Need to define what happens when Friendly Captcha fails. If we're discounting the engagement, we need some transparency for users who may be engaging legitimately but still triggering a captcha failure.)

## Personas

- Users who earn rewards: By discounting inauthentic engagements, engagement rewards for authentic users should increase
- Token manipulators: By discounting inauthentic engagements, manipulators will have fewer tools for gaming the engagement rewards.

## Experiments

I suggest rolling this out not as an A-B experiment, but in phases where we can understand the impact.

- Phase 1: Execute friendly captchas on all upvotes and log the results, without impacting engagement scores. Use captcha-failed events to analyze the effectiveness of the method on identifying inauthentic engagement, and 
- Phase 2: If we're satisfied with the effectiveness, begin discounting engagements that fail the Friendly Captcha. At this point, we need to transparently communicate to users when it's failed.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Authentic engagements (upvotes) function as they do now -- there is no change to the user experience.
- [ ] Inauthentic engagements trigger a toaster message disclosing the captcha fail.
- [ ] Inauthentic engagements are otherwise still recorded.
- [ ] Visualise to users that their vote is in progress
- [ ] Still submit failed events
- [ ] Snowplow 'proof of work' context to be recorded. Success boolean.
- [ ] Add to elastic metrics (like user account quality score does)
- [ ] Add configuration variable to difficult ramp
- [ ] Use feature flags
- [ ] Spec tests

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria

title: Refactor FeedList component with FlashList
description:
## Goal

Improve performance and memory consumption.

The new FlashList component recycles the item components and has a very low JS thread FPS impact compared with the FlatList

## What needs to be done

Reimplement the FeedList component:

- [ ] Move header to the body (FlashList doesn't support sticky on the header)
- [ ] Check how to implement the component injection (Probably we will need getItemType)

## QA

The new component should work correctly on Newsfeed, Channel screen, Groups, and Discovery.

## UX/Design

No changes are required at the beginning of the implementation but we may need some design decisions over changes needed to keep or improve the performance.  

## Personas

It will improve the overall UX of the user, mostly on low-end device

## Experiments

None


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The new component should work correctly on Newsfeed, Channel screen, Groups, and Discovery.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

description:

### Summary

A few users are complaining, about being unable to join cash rewards, because of the Date of Birth validation on the mobile form.

These are bugs that made trying to replicate this unpleasant : https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4346 and https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4347

### Steps to reproduce

description:

When setting DoB through Wallet > Cash > Add bank, user needs to go to their DoB month by month, which is unnecessarily slow and tedious.

Date selection for DoB works only monthbymonth

title: Reset Password link: Issue with Opening the App
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

1. Reset Password link doesn't work if the app is already open in the background.
2. Reset Password link will require users to log in again by navigating them to `WelcomeScreen`

### Steps to reproduce

## Scenario 1

1. Make sure the app is open in the background
2. Make sure you have received a reset password link
3. Click the link (it should open the app)
4. Notice that "Create a new password" modal won't pop up

## Scenario 2
1. Make sure the app is closed
2. Make sure you have received a reset password link
3. Click the link (it should open the app)
4. Notice that you're in the Welcome Screen and if you dismiss the "Create a new password" Modal you'll have to log in again

Note: in Scenario 2, if you close and open the app, you're still logged in (the session won't be lost)

### Platform information

All

### App version

Latest

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

As described above

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

If you click the link and the app is open, it should open the "Create a new password". And if the app is closed, it should not navigate to WelcomeScreen, and user should b able to dismiss the Modal and continue to use the app without having to log in again

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

https://drive.google.com/file/d/19IECVBMzsUAwcgrqABjYSnvfdvGtTtxe/view?usp=sharing

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

2FA modal appears behind "reset password/create new password" modal

title: OnOpenNotification fired twice after tapping on the second push
description:
### Summary

OnOpenNotification fired twice after tapping on the second push notification whit the app in the background.

The event is fired once with the current notification and whit the previous one

### Steps to reproduce

Use an Android 12 device
- Leave the app in the background
- Tap on the first notification (it navigates correctly)
- move the app to the background again
- Tap on the second notification
- It navigates to both notifications

### Platform information 

Android 12

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Event fired twice

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

it should be fired only once with the latest notification

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
-

### Possible fixes

It is an issue with the package's native code

description:

There are numerous instances of list views throughout the mobile app, however, they are largely inconsistent in look and feel. See blow.

and more



## What needs to be done

* [Boosted Content - Settings](https://www.figma.com/file/EkJej3mKP2lSzmWTLoqlXD/Minds-Design-System?node-id=1569%3A10537)
* [Sample light mode](https://www.figma.com/file/EkJej3mKP2lSzmWTLoqlXD/Minds-Design-System?node-id=1608%3A10378)

#### Notes
* Note the common spacing within each list item, regardless of its type.

title: Mutual Channel Subscriptions [mobile]
description:
## Goal

Give channels validation by surfacing any mutual subscriptions to the user. It is a reasonable to believe that users should be more likely to subscribe where their peers are already subscribers. 


## What needs to be done

- [x] Provide designs
- [x] Review designs
- [ ] Get agreement on the logic detailed within the acceptance criteria
- [ ] Run by one of the mobile devs to get any useful feedback


## QA

TBC


## UX/Design

- [Prototype Mobile](https://www.figma.com/proto/WMrvIQMlt2aiXcMsedfvGZ/Channel-%5BMobile%5D?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=1%3A1482&viewport=4810%2C973%2C1&scaling=min-zoom&starting-point-node-id=1%3A1482)

- https://www.figma.com/file/WMrvIQMlt2aiXcMsedfvGZ/Channel-%5BMobile%5D?node-id=1%3A1482


## Personas

TBC


## Experiments

* Not sure if we need to run any experiments here @markryansallee - The basic hypothesis is that users will be more likely to subscribe to channels that their peers already to subscribe to. This is nonetheless a low-risk feature, so perhaps it would be best simply to gather metrics on subscriptions where there mutual subscriptions are displayed, and make the feature available to all. 


## Acceptance Criteria

* Displays only where there are one or more mutual subscriptions (a mutual subscription is where a channel is subscribed to by a channels that the current user subscribes to)
* Will not display when a user is viewing their own channel
* Will display whether a user is subscribed / not subscribed to the channel being viewed.
* A maximum of three avatars will display at any one time.
* Tapping anywhere on the component will launch a modal with all relevant channels.
* Copy: The area here is quite limited so we need to be selective with the language.
  * \[1 mutual subscription\] @channelA is subscribed
  * \[2 mutual subscriptions\] @channelA and @channelB are subscribed
  * \[3 mutual subscriptions\] @channelA, @channelB and 1 other is subscribed
  * \[4+ mutual subscriptions\] @channelA, @channelB and 2 others are subscribed etc.

- [ ] Copy implementation of https://gitlab.com/minds/front/-/merge_requests/1962 (pay attention to language)

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [x] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [x] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Implement new workflow on the CI
description:
## Goal

Improve and simplify our development/release workflow.

 - A more streamlined workflow
 - Single development branch
 - Simplify patch releases
 - Simple code push patch releases

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.35.22](/uploads/46d43e1b08fbeae83fa43bad275e3b87/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.35.22.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.00](/uploads/9b452ca27e5bfec59e6baa43e1f35cad/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.00.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.49](/uploads/15c87dd1c9e6ecb5f216db8ae1fe1435/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.36.49.png)

![Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.42.51](/uploads/6531e493881ce29a07565324c1a3be1d/Screen_Shot_2022-05-20_at_11.42.51.png)

## What needs to be done

- Create a script to get the version from the APK or gradle.properties file/
- Ideally, move the iOS build to gitlab
- Create a fast lane step to deploy directly to the app store (upload_to_app_store)
- Change the CI to match the new workflow:
  - MR branches: `feat/*` `chore/*` `fix/*` `refactor/*`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Review app build (dev tools enabled by default)
    - Deploy to Browserstack for QA
  - Development branch: `development`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Production build
    - Deploy to Browserstack, S3, TestFlight?
  - Master branch: `master`
    - Spec tests
    - Production build
    - Deploy to the Android Stores and Appstore
  - Codepush patch branchs: `patch/*` (Only JS patch)
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Production build
    - Deploy to Browserstack, S3, TestFlight
    - CodePush release for both platforms
  - Native patch branchs: `release/x.x.1`
    - Spec tests
    - e2e?
    - Review app build (dev tools enabled by default)
    - Deploy to Browserstack for QA, S3, TestFlight (manual)

## QA

TBD

## UX/Design

none


## Personas

It will simplify our workflow allowing us to 

## Experiments

none


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] The CI should match the new workflow

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

And it will also improve the UI as the current component doesn't have the same look&feel as the rest of the app


Related issue
https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4040


## What needs to be done

Implement a new generic month selector and replace the wallet->earnings selector

## QA

:warning: Test with the builds for the branch chore/update-rn-0.68 (It was merged on the RN update) :warning:

* open wallet
* earnings tab
* select a month
* the month picker should function flawlessly

## UX/Design

No design necessary

## Personas

It will improve the month selector component and allow us to update to the latest RN version


## Experiments
none

description:

The Social Compass component is not an observer, given that it uses the useApiFetch hook it should be.

Without that the component is not rendered when the useApiFetch information changes, just when the parent does it

### Steps to reproduce

It should be reproduced by debugging the code

### Platform information 

Both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Not reacting to fetch results or errors

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should update when the fetch store observables change

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

none

### Possible fixes

Make it observable

title: Update react-native to 0.68.1
description:
## Goal

This version includes an opt-in for the new architecture (Turbo modules and Fabric renderer) that improves the performance and init speed. But because our app has many dependencies and all of them should implement the new architecture we are not going to be able to use it yet.


## What needs to be done

- Update react-native
- Check if some packages need updating
- Test build/runtime on both platforms

## QA

General smoke testing

## UX/Design

title: Daily push notification for unseen top post
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Increase content engagement and activity in the mobile app by sending a daily push notification to app users promoting an unseen activity post from their top feed.

## What needs to be done

- Automate a daily push notification personalized per user, promoting an unseen activity post from their top feed
- Time the push notification at the time of day that user is typically active in the app
- Add an option to the Notifications setting that allows users to disable this notification (`Top posts`)
- Be able to measure how often these push notifications are used to launch or engage with the app

| Post type                        | Category | Subtitle | Title                                                    | Message / Body (required)                              | Launch URL / Link   | Image                                       |
|----------------------------------|----------|----------|----------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------|---------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| Text post                        |          | (none)   | [Display name / @username] posted                        | [post body]                                            | [activity post URL] | (none)                                      |
| Blog post                        |          | (none)   | [Display name / @username] posted a blog                 | [blog title]                                           | [blog post URL]     | [header image URL] / (none)                 |
| Media post (with title + body)   |          | (none)   | [Display name / @username] posted [an image] / [a video] | [media title]                                          | [activity post URL] | [primary image URL] / [video thumbnail URL] |
| Media post (with title, no body) |          | (none)   | [Display name / @username] posted [an image] / [a video] | [media title]                                          | [activity post URL] | [primary image URL] / [video thumbnail URL] |
| Media post (no title, with body) |          | (none)   | [Display name / @username] posted [an image] / [a video] | [media body]                                           | [activity post URL] | [primary image URL] / [video thumbnail URL] |
| Media post (no title, no body)   |          | (none)   | (none)                                                   | [Display name / @username] posted [an image / a video] | [activity post URL] | [primary image URL] / [video thumbnail URL] |

Sample data:

| Post type (sample)               | Sample                                                                                                       | Title                       | Message / Body                                          | Launch URL / Link                                                                                            | Image                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| Text post                        | https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1351609905466839058                                                           | Minds posted                | Who are your favorite channels on Minds?                | https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1351609905466839058                                                           | (none)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

(Need to define which push notification fields are used, and how they're filled.)

## Personas

- Active, engaged Minds users
- Users who may have installed the app, but forgotten about it

## Experiments


This change should initially be deployed as an experiment, targeting 50% of apps users. We want to measure impact on:

- Sessions per user (per week)
- Engagements per user (per week)
- Content engagement rate (Tasman is building this metric)

Run first on just android device to compare against iOS. Will be monitored outside of Growthbook.

## Acceptance Criteria

Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Given a user is logged into the app, once per day they receive a push notification that promotes an unseen top tweet from their Newsfeed
- [ ] The user can disable notifications like these via the Notifications settings screen in the app
- [ ] Spec tests
- [ ] Add to terraform module the cronjob

title: Plan and define required changes for a more streamlined workflow
description:
## Goal

Define the workflow and the required changes to provide a more streamlined development/release workflow for mobile.

 - Have an automatic build for the current dev branch for both platforms (Currently available for Android only)
 - Ideally, have one single development branch 
 - Ideally, move iOS CI to gitlab
 - Remove current detox e2e from circle CI
 - Add e2e to GitLab CI using the new implementation (Browserstack real devices)
 - It should include codepush patch release

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Documented new workflow
- [ ] Create new tasks for required changes

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

## Created Tasks
 
https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4309

title: Change codepush updates priority
description:
### Summary

Currently, the common updates are installed immediately (causing a restart) and the mandatory updates after the app is sent to the background.

That should be the opposite:
 - Mandatory: inmindatelly
 - Common: After restart

title: Uploads fail on iOS when the app is moved to the background
description:
### Summary

The upload (requests) are canceled when the app is moved to the background (iOS)

### Steps to reproduce

- Open the composer
- attach a large media
- move the app to the background before it finishes the upload

### Platform information 

iOS

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Network request failed

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should continue the upload in the background

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![IMG_AD9BAA3BD269-1](/uploads/6b3fb097ce4665f2863b0b3c582ec614/IMG_AD9BAA3BD269-1.jpeg)

### Possible fixes

Vydia/react-native-background-upload can be useful

title: App stack re-renders while switching user causing some hooks to be fired
description:
### Summary
The main screen of the app (AppStack) is rendered a few times while switching users.

This causes some hooks for example to be fired with the old and new user sessions in a very close window.

In order to prevent some weird race conditions, we should disable the app stack while switching users

### Steps to reproduce

Switch users
- Social compass hook is called with both users

### Platform information 
Both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
- App stack re-renders while switching users

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- App stack should render again when the switch finishes


### Possible fixes

make the AppStack return null while switching users

title: Create Minds chat Android bundle and release it to the app store
Blurhash: Some posts don't get deblurred on Android
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Some posts don't get deblurred on Android

### Steps to reproduce

- use android
- use the latest version (4.24.0)
- Make sure your latest feed contains an image post
- Notice that the blurhash of that image doesn't get removed
  - This issue may not necessarily have anything to do with the first post and other posts might be affected

### Platform information 

Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

I just described above

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Blurhash should only appear when the image hasn't been loaded yet. When the image loads it should get removed. And it shouldn't appear at all if the image was previously loaded.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![blurhash-issue](/uploads/8a52202b7ca7d60553dc9f3b385419ee/blurhash-issue.mov)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Limit camera video resolition to 1080p
description:
## Goal

Improve the upload speed and the backend transcode time by limiting the resolution of the in-app video capture to 1080p

This feature was implemented already in the transcoding MR https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1740 that we will not use for the moment given that it increases the APK size by a 300% and in some devices the transcoding is too slow to provide an actual improvement.

## What needs to be done

Create a new MR only with the implementation for the camera resolution limitation https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1740

## QA



## UX/Design

None


## Personas

It will improve the UX when uploading videos recorded with the app given that the upload time will be reduced.

## Experiments

none


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] It should record videos with a resolution of 1080p
- [ ] It should select the better video resolution in case 1080p is not available on the device

title: Throw a better error message when video upload fails
description:
### Summary

Currently, a network request error is displayed when internet goes down during uploading a video on Minds.

Reported via Testing Channel. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open minds app.
2. Go to composer.
3. Upload a video.
4. Make sure internet connectivity goes bad.

### Platform information 

iOS & Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Throws network error.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should throw a better error message and ask user to try again with internet so it is clear. Wording to be confirmed with @michaelfbradley

title: Unable to Filter content by Date Range
description:
### Summary

When filtering content by date range, user is brought back to "All" as the filter option after inputting the date range and hitting "Done". Range is never accepted, therefore filter is never applied.

### Steps to reproduce

Log in --> filter --> select a valid date range (start and end dates are both in the past or present)

### Platform information 

iPhone and Android app

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Date range filter is never applied, filter behavior reverts to "all". The radial button never moves.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Radial button should move to the selected range, indicating a successful application of the filter.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![iPhone_SetRange](/uploads/f72edd7874b82b2959e16a68360b33c2/iPhone_SetRange.mp4)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Add codepush release creation steps on the CI
description:
## Goal

Be able to do patch releases in a quick way using code push and only pressing a button on the CI

## What needs to be done

We need to create a new CI stage that will be available for the patch/x.y.z branches.

It should include
 - Spect tests
 - Manual job to deploy to code push `staging`
 - Manual job to deploy to code push `production`

## QA

It should be tested until the staging step.

- Create a patch/x.y.z branch with some changes
- Run the staging deploy on the CI
- Check on appcenter that the bundle is uploaded

Extra test for the entire flow (in-app update)

- Install the stanging version of the app (The latest Minds-release-x_y_z.apk)
- It should update silently and the changes should be visible after restarting the app

## UX/Design

-

## Personas

Developers: Improve our release flow
Users: receive update faster and silently

## Experiments

-


## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] It should add the required steps to the CI
- [ ] It should do the bundle for each platform in a separate job and in parallel (In case one fail we can run it again)

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

The issue seems to be with the v2/entities endpoint

title: Update report categories
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal


The goal is to streamline the report modal by clarifying categories and removing duplicate and/or unused entries.

## What needs to be done

Report categories should be updated to reflect the chart in the following section. Below is a list of changes:

**Text-only changes**

1. Change 'pedophilia' to 'sexualization of minors'
2. Change 'Encourages or incites violence' to 'Incitement to violence'
3. Change 'Impersonates' to 'Impersonation'
4. Change 'Copyright' to 'Intellectual Property Violation'
5. Change 'Token manipulation' to 'Inauthentic engagement'
6. Change "Sex trafficking" to "Trafficking"

**Removals**

Remove the following categories:

1. Trademark infringement (because it is merged with IP violation)
2. Incorrect use of hashtags (because it does nothing)

**Modifications**

Under 'Intellectual Property Violations' (formerly 'Copyright') we need to link to the Zendesk DMCA form instead of saying to email to copyright@minds.com.

https://support.minds.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360003221852

![image](/uploads/3468e4dcc934af01a792d1680dbaf7da/image.png)

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

Minimal QA: make sure reporting under the new labels generates the correct report.

Check emails.

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

...

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why
--->

This change impacts typical Minds users who make reports.

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

No experiments are needed.

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Labels are correctly changed for users on the report modal

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Replace rn-placeholder with Moti's skeleton
description:
## Goal

Remove unnecessary dependency and improve the performance/smoothness of the loading placeholders of the app.

## What needs to be done

1. Replace the placeholders of `rn-placeholder` with the new Moti's skeleton (implemented with reanimated)

Components to be refactored:

- ChannelListItemPlaceholder
- DiscoveryTrendPlaceHolder
- ActivityPlaceHolder 
- NotificationPlaceHolder
- BarPlaceholder
- UpgradeScreenPlaceHolder

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

See More Page navigates below the bottom sheet

### Steps to reproduce

on channel recommendation widget anywhere -> press see more -> press on a recommendation => navigation happens beneath the bottom sheet

### Platform information 

both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

I just explained above

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

navigation should happen on top of the bottom sheet.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Simulator_Screen_Recording_-_iPhone_13_-_2022-04-14_at_13.18.19](/uploads/0287902d2185ed7edaf83d92bb2a2463/Simulator_Screen_Recording_-_iPhone_13_-_2022-04-14_at_13.18.19.mov)

### Possible fixes

We fixed this in hashtags component by differentiating the navigation ∫ased on whether we're navigating with the `NavigationService` navigation. My proposed quick fix is to do the same thing with the ChannelListItem but Ideally, we want to manage this in a central place so issues like this won't happen again

title: NSFW Posts disappear on iOS
description:
### Summary

Now that we are filtering NSFW post, they look weird when they automatically disappear from the profile and newsfeed for the user who created the post. 

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Open minds app on iOS.
2. Login successfully. 
3. Navigate to profile or newsfeed.
4. Create a post.
5. Edit post and mark as NSFW.
6. Post disappears

### Platform information 

v4.23 - iOS

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Post disappears

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

To discuss - mostly post should stay with warning if it is your own post.

### What needs to be done?

Remove the option to create NSFW content.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![PostDisappears](/uploads/9eaddc12894c048ea21942fa77039600/PostDisappears.mov)

title: Update Boost Settings UI to introduce new setting options
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

- Add value to Minds+ subscription prop
- Give Minds+ customers more control of their content
- Give content owners more control over how their content is presented
- Enable eligible customers to earn more from Boost partners by enabling more lucrative audience targeting

## What needs to be done

Enable Minds+/Pro subscribers to disable Boosts on their content, including channel pages, SEPs, etc.

Bonus if the control is exposed to non-subscribers and used as a point of converting to a Minds+ subscriber.

Give all users an option to enable/disable Controversial Boosts from appearing on pages they own (channel pages, SEPs, etc.).

https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/2519

title: Preserve UTM codes in link previews
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Enable marketers to measure the impact of posting on Minds / Boosting on Minds.

## What needs to be done

When an activity post contains a link with UTM parameters, and a link preview is added to the post, then the link preview should maintain the UTM parameters.

Currently, UTM parameters are preserved if the user clicks the URL address in the post, but not if the user clicks the link preview.

Example post: https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1467274467364311058

![Untitled](/uploads/bb5cb74fd8e6e7e85a650b94fbe760ee/Untitled.png)

title: Put Twitter API integrations behind feat flag and turn off
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Deprecate Twitter API integrations in such a way that if their recent decisions on their API are reversed, we can resume normal operation.

## What needs to be done

Gate Twitter API integrations behind a feature flag - turn the flag off on deploy for prod.

## QA

Test integrations are gated and nothing breaks.

## UX/Design

**TO BE DISCUSSED RAPIDLY**

## Mobile

<!---
Does a mobile card need to be created? Any notes for mobile?
--->

- [x] Is Mobile Required?

@valentin129 please track this card closely. Feel free to chat with me about it. Confirm with everybody before starting.

## Personas

Twitter Sync users

## Experiments

Create flag names `engine-2503-twitter-apis` - when this is OFF access to the Twitter API is OFF.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Deprecate endpoints that integrate with Twitter API by using Feature flag middleware if they're V3 endpoints else add checks in the endpoints themselves or managers - decide on best strategy based on what presents - do a scan but I think this is the OAuth2 flow for Supermind and possible XPosting.
- [ ] Feat flag off other pathways to the API such as the runner, and possibly delegates on boost creation
- [ ] Update UI to put references including OAuth2 setup, Xposting setup and settings, Supermind checkbox etc behind the feat flag.
- [ ] When flag is OFF access to the API is OFF.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [x] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [x] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [x] QA
- [x] UX/Design
- [x] Personas
- [x] Experiments

title: Implement the upgrade to minds+ in-feed notice
description:
## Goal

The Upgrade to Minds+ in-feed notice is missing on mobile. 

We need to implement this on mobile

https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/3639


Learn what value prop messaging for Minds+ best converts for all users in the context of the Newsfeed.

## What needs to be done

Deploy an experiment that tests various messages via an in-feed notice on the Newsfeed, prompting users to upgrade to Minds+.

![image](/uploads/9316b831ca7d657101e76ce90f14c107/image.png)

| Notice            | Description                                                                                                                                                        | Dismissable | Position | Sticky | Display priority | Conditions                                               | Primary action               | Secondary action                  |
|-------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------|----------|--------|------------------|----------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| Upgrade to Minds+ | Support Minds and unlock features such as earning revenue for your content, hiding ads, accessing exclusive content, receiving a badge and verifying your channel. | Yes         | Top      | No     | 3.2              | Channel is NOT already Plus, and is at least 30 days old | Upgrade (opens Minds+ modal) | Learn More (opens minds.com/plus) |
| Upgrade to Minds+ | Free-thinking content creators like you earn more and grow their reach with Minds+.                                                                                | Yes         | Top      | No     | 3.2              | Channel is NOT already Plus, and is at least 30 days old | Upgrade (opens Minds+ modal) | Learn More (opens minds.com/plus) |
| Upgrade to Minds+ | Access exclusive content produced by the Minds+ community.                                                                                                         | Yes         | Top      | No     | 3.2              | Channel is NOT already Plus, and is at least 30 days old | Upgrade (opens Minds+ modal) | Learn More (opens minds.com/plus) |
| Upgrade to Minds+ | Get verified, hide ads, and get the most of your Minds experience.                                                                                                 | Yes         | Top      | No     | 3.2              | Channel is NOT already Plus, and is at least 30 days old | Upgrade (opens Minds+ modal) | Learn More (opens minds.com/plus) |
| Upgrade to Minds+ | Support Minds and creators like you.                                                                                                                               | Yes         | Top      | No     | 3.2              | Channel is NOT already Plus, and is at least 30 days old | Upgrade (opens Minds+ modal) | Learn More (opens minds.com/plus) |

## QA

Same as front

## UX/Design

https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/3639

## Experiments

It should be behind an experiment FF like the front end

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] A new notice must be aded

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Controlled mandatory codepush UX
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The mandatory codepush now lets the user use the app and once the codepush is downloaded it will restart the app. This causes bad UX since the user could be writing a comment or posting something in the meanwhile. Ideally, we should either keep the user waiting on a splash screen, prevent the unexpected restart, or show a mandatory update prompt. Or a combination of these solutions

### Steps to reproduce

- do a mandatory codepush
- open the app
- notice that at some point the app will get restarted

### Platform information 

all

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

app unexpectedly restarts

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

restart should be controlled. The mandatory update UX should be taken care of

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

N/A

### Possible fixes

- if the app is on cold start show a screen showing download or just wait + progress bar
- if the app is moved to the background or comes to foreground.

title: Communicate upcoming Boost changes to Boosters
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

- Inform current Boosters about the upcoming changes to Boost
- And that the switchover may impact the Boost they are about to create

## What needs to be done

Add some messaging to the current Boost modal that communicates that (a) things are changing soon, and that (b) their Boost delivery may different than expected because of it.

Link copy points to: https://www.minds.com/info/blog/bid-farewell-the-boost-backlog-1445548466339057665

Given we will likely have a sizable Boost backlog of v2 Boosts when we're ready to switch to v3, @benhayward.ben proposed migrating v2 Boosts to v3 system. The user impact is that their Boosts will effectively be moved to the bidding system, in which their view numbers are not guaranteed. Customers should be aware of this possibility with their newly-purchased v2 Boosts.

![image](/uploads/7d8e86b714dd696d8cd5ff09c7dcd910/image.png)

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed

title: Warning for Minds Plus content on iOS in need of design work
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

The warning on iOS for Plus seems off 

- The blur may not be using blurhash correctly
- The component displaying `minds+ is not available on this platform` looks out of place and difficult to read - on web these are usually centrally aligned.
- I have no idea what the unlock button does, if the post is not viewable on iOS.
 
One thing to note is this is multi-image.

### Steps to reproduce

Look at a plus post on iOS
- make sure the test account has no minds+ options enabled
- search for `JohnG76` and scroll on his feed
- reminded locked posts have the lock not centered.
- posts with `The media could not be loaded` ave the lock not centered.
- the activity is rendered correctly at the beginning and re-rendered wrong immediately.

### Platform information 

Mobile

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Visually unappealing

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Should be designed and implemented accordingly.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![image](/uploads/52d9e4599efd966a1cbae678a12f9408/image.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Last accessed field for all sessions is incorrect
description:
### Summary

Last accessed field is incorrect for all sessions displayed. Works correctly on Web. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open mobile app.
2. Navigate to settings -> security.
3. Tap on Your Devices.
4. Notice that all sessions have the same timestamp which is the current timestamp. This is not possible and does not match web values. 

### Platform information 

iPhone 13 Pro

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Last accessed field value is incorrect. 

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Last accessed field value should be accurate.

title: Add Boost-related context to 'action' events
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

- As Minds, I want to know what is the engagement rate of Boosted posts in various positions in the app so that I can optimize the performance of Boosts.
- As a Boost user, I want to know what engagements on my post are attributable to a Boost, so that I can evaluate the ROI for Boosting.

## What needs to be done

Add context to engagement events (upvotes, downvotes, reminds, comments) that enables us to discern these engagements from organic appearances and Boosted appearances.

Possibly: Use existing Boost campaign `event_props`, `view_campaign`, and/or `view_medium` attributes.

Possibly need to add a context for boosts or just marked the events with is_a_boost flag.

title: Automate Changelog Generation
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

In order to avoid merge conflict headaches resulting from manually updating the CHANGELOG.md, we can leverage [Gitlab changelog entries](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/changelog.html) and have the changelog updates as part of the CI.

https://github.com/jimmidyson/gitlab-ce/blob/master/doc/development/changelog.md#history-and-reasoning

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- document usage of `Changelog` git trailer
- add the generate_changelog to the pipeline and only run on master
- make sure the commit to update the changelog doesn't run all pipelines. Add a `[skip ci]` or similar keyword in the commit message and prevent pipelines running for that commit 


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed

None

None

title: In-feed notice: Invite your friends
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

As Minds, I want to inform active users about mechanisms and incentives for referring friends, so that active users invite more friends to Minds.


## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

Create an in-feed notice that prompts users to invite friends from the Newsfeed.

| Notice         | Description                                                                                                                                  | Dismissable | Position | Sticky | Display priority | Conditions                            | Primary action                                                            | Secondary action                                                    |
|----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------|----------|--------|------------------|---------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Invite friends | Minds gets better with friends. Share your referral link to invite them to join. If they earn money on Minds, you'll earn a 5% referral fee. | Yes         | Top      | No     | Shuffle                | All users | Share invite (copy referral URL; on mobile, display native share options) | Learn more (link to https://www.minds.com/settings/other/referrals) |


## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--

--->

- [ ] The `Invite friends` in-feed notice appears for eligible users in the Newsfeed
- [ ] The primary and secondary buttons click through to the actions described above
- [ ] When the Primary button is clicked on web, a toast message reads: `Invite link copied to clipboard`
- [ ] View and click events are recorded to understand the efficacy of the notice

title: Clarify expectations with Twitter connection for Supermind
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues

--->

## Goal

As a user responding to a Supermind, I want to know why Minds is requesting permission to post on my behalf and know that nothing is being posted just by connecting w/ Twitter oauth.

As a user responding to a Supermind, I want to visualize what will be posted to Twitter before agreeing to it.

## What needs to be done

Spec improvements to the UX of flows related to posting Superminds to Twitter to address the user stories above.

- Flow 1: Connecting to Twitter oauth before responding to a Supermind offer that requires Twitter repost. (Happens once for a user.)
- Flow 2: Reposting a Supermind respond to Twitter. (Can happen multiple times for a user.)

description:

### Summary

The see latest prompt positioning is awkward and it sometimes blocks content underneath it without being dismissible. These issues should be resolved.

### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- positioning of the "see latest" prompt is wrong
- it is not dismissible

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- position of the prompt should be near the top of the newsfeed
- it should be dismissible, either manual, automatic, or both (with timeout).

description:

For this change, we want to add the option to boost from any post.

title: Update Boost in-app / push notifications
description:
## Goal

Improve Boost in-app / push notifications.

As a customer, I want in-app notifications so that I have confidence about the status of my order. 

## What needs to be done

Automate the delivery of in-app and push notifications to customers, alerting them to the current status of their Boost orders.

![image](/uploads/ea684928c25e8050a7175f5d6ea0df1f/image.png)

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

- Use standard in-app notification layout.
- Use Boost icon

| Event               | Subject                    |
|---------------------|----------------------------|
| Boost rejected      | Your Boost was rejected.   |
| Boost start running | Your Boost is now running. |
| Boost completed     | Your Boost is complete.    |

[Events](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_9_G5MwrmFZ7fVzR_nuLpUKVY8BhAksrCUnaOIHkhqI/edit#gid=0)

## Personas

Boost customers

## Experiments

n/a

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] A customer receives a notification when a Boost is rejected.
- [ ] A customer receives a notification when a Boost begins running.
- [ ] A customer receives a notification when a Boost order is complete.
- [ ] The notifications click through to the Boost console where they manage the Boost order.
- [ ] Rejected boosts should link to the activity post/channel
- [ ] Non-rejected boost notifications should go to the boost console

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Mobile: Boost rejection reasons not displayed correctly in Boost console
description:
### Summary

The Boost rejection messages in the Boost console are not displaying properly.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a Boost
- Navigate to the Boost console

### Platform information 

- Android app

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

- If the Boost is not rejected, the rejection reason area shows `[missing "en.boost.rejectionReasons.-1" translation]`
- If the Boost is rejected due to backlog overflow, the rejection reason message is `Onchain payment failed`

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- If the Boost is not rejected, the rejection reason area does not show
- If the Boost is rejected due to backlog overflow, the rejection reason message is `Due to high boost backlog, your tokens have been auto-refunded.`

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Screenshot_20221219-100044](/uploads/fb3930291b2233ce2ab12af4bf706121/Screenshot_20221219-100044.png)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Pressing 'x' on 2fa after registration fails to log user in
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When creating account, when pressing 'x' on 2fa prompt, user is "logged out" (I presume they are never logged in). It's still possible to log back in, but it shouldn't happen this way

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create account
2. get to 2fa screen
3. Press x
4. notice that the new user is logged out

### Platform information 

Android, HuaweiHonor9, 4.30.1

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

User is never logged in when creating account and pressing x on 2fa

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Pressing x on 2fa should make no difference on login status of the user

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![XRecorder_09122022_175245](/uploads/062fe5d1fca04d4964a38e699d8b528e/XRecorder_09122022_175245.mp4)

title: investigate why intl is not working correctly on iOS
description:
following from https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1637#note_831302733

for instance, `toLocaleString` is not transforming `25000` to `25,000`

title: refactor: more general naming for useApiPost
description:
following from https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/1637#note_831290732

candidates are: useApiRequest, useApi, useApiCall.

the other point is whether useApiPost and useApiFetch should be merged. e.g. into something like useApi. 
i don't feel like they should because then we'd have a single fetch() method in the response store which doesn't make sense when we're posting something (naming-wise). but maybe we can do something about that. let's figure out

title: Check if we can standarize the keyboard handling and make a PoC
description:
### Summary

Despite mobile's keyboard handling is sometimes a cumbersome task (Even more on React-Native)

In many parts of the app, we are applying a combination of a KeyboardSpacing component and changing the SoftInputMode for android.

We should check if we can safely move the SoftInputMode logic inside the KeyboardSpacing component itself. 

The KeyboardSpacer component was necessary due to some inconsistencies between platforms of the KeyboardAvodingView and an issue detecting correctly the height of the keyboard in some devices. (At that moment, it may be no longer the case)

title: Add network_id to snowplow and cookies
description:
### Summary

We need to generate and send the networkUserId (UUID) to snowplow (Android). This UUID should be stored at the app level (shared by all the users of the device)

For both platforms, we have to add a minds_pseudoid cookie with the id

We need to ensure that sp_minds and the minds_pseudoid cookies are sent on every HTTP call

title: Android build error due missing com.github.prscX:photo-editor-android:master-SNAPSHOT
description:

Unable to build android due to an error in one of the dependencies

> Could not resolve all files for configuration ':app:debugRuntimeClasspath'.
   > Could not find com.github.prscX:photo-editor-android:master-SNAPSHOT.
```
