title: (bug) 4.21.0 | App closes when pressing "back" button from comments
description:
I tried pressing "back" button from multiple spots in the app - discovery, notifications, menu, comments. When going back from discovery, notifications and menu, I went to the feed. When going back from comments, I went to the home screen (it threw me out of the app)

Video:

![XRecorder_01022022_065318](/uploads/21e02f5b0ba04681d0c6475e2d40f337/XRecorder_01022022_065318.mp4)

Reference: User Cactus_Lord here - https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1334763669329809419

title: (bug) 4.21 Notifications | Notifications persist in unread status after reading
description:
Notifications in mobile app don't go into "read" status.

How to replicate:
- Open app
- See unread notifications, click the icon
- Click back to the feed

After those actions, the bell still has red dot next to it. When I open the notification on the mobile, and go back to the notification list, the notification still has blue dot.

Related post: https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1334875929192697864

title: Newsfeed spinner placement
description:
The positioning of the spinner on the newsfeed is incorrect. It is currently being displayed above the header, whereas it should be position under the header. It should display in the same way as Discovery currently does.

![Screenshot_2022-01-31_at_09.14.45](/uploads/df34dea237f41722c4ace4de5bf4ab8c/Screenshot_2022-01-31_at_09.14.45.png)

cc @msantang78

title: Report comment option is not working
description:
### Summary

The report screen is failing to open when it opened from a comment

### Steps to reproduce

Open a comment of another user and tap the `report` option of the menu

### Platform information 

Android and iOS

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
Failing to open

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
It should open the report screen

description:

Discovery should have a collapsible header like the other screens.

Android and iOS

title: [GAT] Nothing happens on tapping the Messenger menu on the Account page
description:
### Summary

Messenger option under Settings -> Accounts does not do anything. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Launch the App and login
2. Tap on Hamburger menu>Settings>Account
3. Tap on the Messenger option"

### Platform information 

Android 11.0 11, Samsung Galaxy M11 

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Nothing happens on tapping on Messenger option

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Messenger option if visible should be actionable.

title: Comment input closes the bottomsheet on Android
description:
### Summary

If the user closes the bottom sheet by swiping down while the comment input is visible. The bottom sheet will fail to open the next time.

### Steps to reproduce

 - Tap on the comment icon in a post
 - Tap add comment
 - Close the bottom sheet by swiping down
 - Tap again on the comment icon to open the comments again. 
   The bottom sheet opens but it is closed down immediately 

### Platform information 
Android

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Close the bottom sheet on the next open

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It shouldn't affect the functionality

### Possible fixes

Hide the input when the bottom sheet is closed

title: Group search is not working on mobile
description:
### Summary

No results are shown when searching groups on mobile (Discovery search)

### Steps to reproduce

- Search for some common word and select the group tab on discovery

### Platform information 

Android and iOS

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Not results shown

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should show the same results as the web

### Possible fixes

Check endpoint and parameters to replicate web functionality

title: Small navigation related refactors
description:
@msantang78 - navigation is looking great. Just two small areas to address, then we should be all good.

- [x] Please remove the animation currently present on the menu screen. We can create a future task to add refined navigation animation in the future, but for now I'd be happy to simply remove it.

- [x] The height of the lower nav bar should be modified to better match the designs here. Currently it's a little short, and the buttons are very low. See below.

- [x] Can you please increase the size of the search and chat icons in the header, to better match the designs below. They are currently on the small side.

https://www.figma.com/proto/EkJej3mKP2lSzmWTLoqlXD/Minds-Design-System?node-id=60%3A84&scaling=scale-down&page-id=60%3A83

title: Password visibility should be added for all textboxes with password
description:
### Summary

This is an improvement request that any passwords entered across the application should have the eye button to hide/show password. This can be extremely helpful when user enters a typo in the password and can fix it easily rather than retyping the entire password. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Navigate to Minds.
2. Go to Change Password page or any other page where password is entered in a textbox.

Notice that no eye icon exists to see the password.

### Platform information 

Android & iOS

title: Random full bleed media in moments
description: I actually prefer full bleed, but our icons are not optimized for this. In the attached image, look at bottom. Sometime it goes all the way to bottom, which i actually like. But either way we need consistency.

title: Comment input not visible
description:
### Summary

Comments input is behind the comments bottom sheet

 - The input should be shown but is not visible
 - Close the bottom sheet and the input is visible behind

### Platform information 

Android and iOS

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The input should be on top of everything

### Possible fixes
The bottom sheet uses teleport to render the modals on the main screen. We need to use the same (Maybe the floating input that I implemented)

title: (bug) Images | Weird aspect ratio when opening images
description:
I found out while testing the https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/4030, some pictures seem to have wrong ratio.

The sushi picture I open in the video has ratio of 1:1 but on phone it's squished. Same with the meme I open later, it should almost take full screen, but it's really squished.

It also doesn't seem to be working on all pictures. I tried some of photos made by ishiyo, and they were showing properly.

![untitled](/uploads/c4a164ad911633e0bf3b78135cfd0ed8/untitled.mp4)

## Tested on
- I have android .apk version

title: Create a POC for running Mobile Automation on Real Devices
description:
### Summary

This task covers creating a working automation test case for mobile application that tests the application on a real device. It will include researching out other options available apart from Browserstack. 

Some work on WebdriverIO + Browserstack has already been done. Compare if we can find anything better that provides stable automation across real devices.

End Result: 
- Working login test case as an example on a real Android and iOS

title: Revised mobile login and registration action points [Creative review]
description:
Please see below a list of minor refactors to be made to the login and registration screens on mobile.

I should have caught the following before it got released. Please see below some important action items.

For reference, a click-through can be found here -> https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/ygYdmgo/play

### Landing screen

- [x] General layout issues - Original design: https://www.sketch.com/s/e8802a80-da55-4421-b961-564f40bc3845/a/v8mpY2J
  - [x] The positioning of the lower buttons do not match the designs. The should be position relative to the bottom of the screen, so there is less white space between the lower button and the bottom of the screen.
![Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_13.00.17](/uploads/4da35cedfeb13422bda60813beaa316b/Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_13.00.17.png)
  - [x] The size and positioning of the Minds logo isn't quite right.

### Registration
- [x] General layout issues - Original design: https://www.sketch.com/s/e8802a80-da55-4421-b961-564f40bc3845/a/Gm5EDg5
  - [x] On iOS (iPhone 13) the Join Minds button is hidden behind the keyboard. The user is unable to scroll, but then had to close the keyboard to continue.
    - [x] Disable word auto complete above the keyboard which is consuming quite a bit of space. Also the emoji keyboard and speech to text controls could be disabled.
    - [ ] Adjust the height of the text inputs so they match the designs. They are taller in the implementation. 
    - [x] Fix the colour issue at the top of the action sheet. ![Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_13.13.00](/uploads/b48c5c0023aea18c63207ff5c26edbce/Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_13.13.00.png)
- [x] Functional issues
  - [x] When trying to register an existing username, I'm able to proceed to the CAPTCHA screen. The user shouldn't be able to proceed beyond the registration screen without all the validation criteria being met.
  - [x] Inline form validation messaged doesn't appear when no password is provided.

### Login screen

- [x] The incorrect username/password toast notification should only display when a username and password has been provided.
- [x] There should be inline form validation messages displayed (same as registration) if either the username or password has been omitted.
- [x] The spacing under the header should be increased to match the general action sheet design.

### Password reset

- [x] When transitioning from screen one to screen 2, we should persist the height of the modal, so there is no jump.
- [x] The implementation of password reset don't match the designs (https://www.sketch.com/s/3e7a8f54-04a5-4374-8bda-9de901f2afb6/a/AxYA3wr/play)
  - [x] The header text size seems to be off.
  - [x] The close icon (top right) seems a little misaligned and is the wrong colour.
  - [x] Missing the border under the header 
  - [x] Missing the drag down indicator at the top of the modal.

![Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_14.21.48](/uploads/5bb79f560d03d5eccba6e0ce81306f47/Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_14.21.48.png)

- [x] Back navigate icon not working very well. I need to tap multiple times for this to function.
- [x] The header text size seems to be off.
- [x] The close icon (top right) seems a little misaligned and is the wrong colour.
- [x] Missing the border under the header 
- [x] Missing the drag down indicator at the top of the modal.

![Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_14.25.45](/uploads/cb68105643fa8c5b31d5e72f0ca3d972/Screenshot_2021-12-17_at_14.25.45.png)

cc @msantang78 @manishoo @tanyatech

title: [GAT-MDS-7-1] Unable to connect the Wallet due to phone verification flow failure.
description:
Component:
Wallet

Steps to reproduce:
Launch the app.
Login to the account.
Tap the "Wallet" icon on the top right of the screen.
Tap the "Connect Wallet" button.
Type the "2408011889" in the "Phone Number" input field.
Tap the "Send Verification Code" button.
Type in the confirmation code from SMS.
Tap the "Confirm" button.
Observe the "Phone Verification" screen. 

Severity:
High

Attachments:
https://tracker.testerwork.com/image_files/a6bbbc732e1531002f370dea96631afe72ebea99f54e0a7a4ca16a7433523718566521dfaa6273f4710fdb9db31d7189, https://tracker.testerwork.com/video_files/ec126509310b1722a133b0abf2a4952c68d16726d3e5e111e421c71bbfa97c9867920402c98550b3330e3fa007b6062f, https://tracker.testerwork.com/video_files/952c9fca8e0d57920f00a1bd0749ede14c6a394cf9631f1abc0629e45aff60018c03e99bb1670f7ceb78625c9074a057

Test case id:


Country:
United States

Description:
Actual results
The phone verification is failed.  
Nothing happened after 2 attempts. And about 10 minutes later, the reminder message "Please connect your wallet"  was displayed.

Expected results
The phone verification is completed, and the wallet is connected. 



Environment:
platform_info: Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra, Android 12.0 12
operating_system: -
mobile_device_name: Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra
web_browser_and_version: -
operating_system_version: Android 12.0 12

Credentials:


Repro rate x5 1:

title: Discovery: Add "Top" tab (mobile app)
description:
In order to improve the quality of content on the Discovery page, and to drive engagement to our top content, we want to:

1. Add a new `Top` tab  to the Discovery page.
2. Use the feed powering the Guest Mode homepage to present posts in this `Top` feed.
3. Make `Top` the default tab when clicking the `Discovery` button in the Minds navigation.

Quick mock to illustrate:

![image](/uploads/51b51050d468b7edae4d5f52a1ba5c03/image.png)

- [ ] Follow experiment https://gitlab.com/minds/minds/-/issues/2869

When you submit the social compass questionnaire, there is no confirmation message that it has been successfully submitted.

3. Answer all the questions.
4. Hit Save button.

All web and mobile platforms

Confirmation text must appear when the questionnaire is submitted.

title: No ability to refresh comments on mobile
description: The normal expectation would be that users could pull to refresh posts. Currently when 'pulling to refresh' the comments pane simply closes. Furthermore, sockets are currently disabled. The only way a user to able to get fresh comments is to close, then re-open the comments pane.

title: Comment push notifications don't always redirect to the relevant question
description:
See steps below on replicating this issue.

- View comments on a given post
- Close the app
- When a new comment notification is received, tapping on it opens the app, but the redirection never happens.
- Also after receiving a push notification on an upvote, the direction never happens. The user simply remains on the original comment thread.

Please see video below.

![RecordIt-1638275199](/uploads/6fa81f8fc5f1cf2074364c75c139ec70/RecordIt-1638275199.MP4)

(bug): Can't see comment replies without scrolling down
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

From the user 

Every so often when someone replies to one of my comments I can’t see them at all. The screen video shows me clicking on it multiple times but nothing shows (see link below)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Login to app.
2. Go to a popular post (try in Help and Support), make sure it has comment reply trees. 
3. Position the screen so the reply button is at the bottom. 
4. Click it
5. Observe you have to scroll down to see the comment.

### Platform information 

Replicated Ubuntu / Chromium

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

User has to scroll down to see their comment replies.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

It should auto-scroll.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

[**Video in link**]
https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/944094010648371200

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: (bug): Android Blog comments showing previous posts comments when browsing through.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### 

Blog posts will show the comments of the previously viewed post rather than the current one. 

### Steps to reproduce

1.  Visit the blogs section
2.  Open a blog, scroll down to see the comments
3.  Go back, click the next blog
4.  Scroll down to the comments

### Platform information

Android S7 Edge (8.0.0)

### App version

v3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Comments are shown for the previous post.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The correct comments should be shown.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/947150458587721728

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

(bug): Deleting all characters in email address listed on "Change Email" page in settings causes white screen with loading icon which spins forever.
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

See screen recording below. Also, holding down the backspace button causes the same issue once one character been deleted. The only way to replace the current email address (at least in the iOS app) is to hold --> select all and paste the new email address.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Press options button
2. Press "Settings"
3. Press "Email"
4. Tap the input field
5. Press the backspace button until all characters are deleted

### Platform information

iOS 12.1 / iPhone SE

### App version

3.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Deleting all characters in email address listed on "Change Email" page in settings causes white screen with loading icon which spins forever. Also, holding down the backspace button causes the same issue once one character has been deleted.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

You should be able to delete all characters either by tapping or holding the backspace button so you can then start typing the new email address.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![39](/uploads/bc625c1416505fd6cbd1b1a976b20951/39.mp4)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

Remind action delivers user back to your newsfeed instead of back to where you reminded from

IOS

 3.2.0 (201902170002)

title: Store release - 4.35.0 - Android and iOS
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
Store release - v4.35.0


## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->
Run a smoke test and review all already tested tasks from staging environment.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->
- store release for Android and iOS

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

## Mobile

<!---
Does a mobile card need to be created? Any notes for mobile?
--->

- [ ] Is Mobile Required?

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] ...

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Mob: Channel & Group suggestions in onboarding
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Increase the % of newly registered users who subscribe to channels and join groups in their first session, to improve short term user retention.

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- Interest tag selection is not skippable -- user must select at least 3 interests before proceeding.
- Add Channel and Group suggestions in new user onboarding flow, after user interest tag selection.
- Channel & Group suggestions are influenced by tag selections.
- Channel & Group suggestions ARE skippable.

Deploy as an experiment.

- Control: Tag selection is not skippable, but Channel & Group suggestions are not presented during onboarding.
- Variant: Tag selection is not skippable, and Channel & Group suggestions are presented afterward.

Measure for:

- Channel subscriptions
- Group joins
- User returned after 48 hours

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->



![mob-variant-actual-final](/uploads/96c606e1a021bf0e051c8cd101de19d4/mob-variant-actual-final.mov)

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/KIrgbpzbogAlPq8Ln1qDHF/NUX-Research-and-UX?node-id=168-20021)


## Mobile

<!---
Does a mobile card need to be created? Any notes for mobile?
--->

- [x] Is Mobile Required?

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->


## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->

Metrics to watch 
- Number of subscribers per user 
- We hypothesized that since number of subscribers positively correlates to retention for the data we've seen, that if a user subscribes to a greater number of channels / is served more relevant content, they are more likely to retain and stay on the platform.
- 2-3 day retention (user signs up, uses Minds, closes app, rejoins, logs back in and uses within window)

- variant vs. control (existing design)

## Acceptance Criteria

<!--
Everyone should be able to understand what is expected to be delivered
--->

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted

- [ ] Experiments

title: Mob: Hide suspected spam comments
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Reduce impact of spam by hiding comments that are suspected of spam.

## What needs to be done

We can automatically identify that comments are spam with a high degree of accuracy, but still want human review before they're removed from the site. When a comment is automatically identified as spam -- but before human review -- we should hide the comments from view, and enable the community to show the comments and give feedback about whether or not the automatic spam detection was accurate.

[We got some feedback from the community about a feature like this here](https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1437588985613389832).

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->



![spam-desktop-flow](/uploads/0d494a05e0ca7677f30b36c62c31aba4/spam-desktop-flow.png)

![spam-mobile-flow](/uploads/3f9db355b4f97ef5692d20cab663ba3c/spam-mobile-flow.png)

title: Referrals link is invisible on dark / light mode (Mobile)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)

If a user uses dark mode on mobile, and tries to access the referrals link, they can go to the current referrals page. However, the referral link text is currently invisible. (referral link text is same as background color.)

The problem manifest only when switching from one mode to another. The color of default text do not update correctly.


### Steps to reproduce

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

Step 1: On mobile app, switch to dark mode. 
Step 2: Go on sidebar navigation menu, and access settings page. 
Step 3: Go from the settings page to other -> click on referrals page.
Step 4: On referrals page, view referral links, and you will notice that the css-color of the link is not being changed between light and dark mode.

Note- sometimes this flips, so that light mode is legible, but dark mode is not. See below. 

![image](/uploads/0b59e39aaf6efa209d68f56f2736cc5e/image.png)

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)
- Mobile apps (React Native, iOS, Android)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

(What actually happens)

![image](/uploads/2be937712b6679f69d2666ed92cabcb9/image.png)

![image](/uploads/a632ed26beed6cff6e3e12f0297d080d/image.png)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

- expected behavior should be white text in dark mode, primary text in light mode.


(What you should see instead)

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Mob: Retain referrer for 72h
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->
In order to expand the affiliates program, we wish to be able to use the referral links for logged in users too. The tags can then be used to attribute the referrer. 

In the case of a deeplink with referral, extract the referrer and save it for 72h.
All subsequent API calls will add the referrer as header/member in payload.
Should handle multiuser: referrer sent for all users or bound to the current user who processed the initial deeplink (@markryansallee pls clarify)

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->
- extract referrer from deeplink with referral, and save it for 72h.
- add the referrer as header/member in payload for all subsequent API calls.

See AC below

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed

Affiliates

- [ ] Referral param (referrer) will expire after 72 hours
- [ ] Referral param (referrer) should work for existing logged in users

title: Moments: Timer
description:
## Goal

Improve Moments UX

---

As a Minds, I want to increase Boost inventory supply so that I can better fulfill the demands of customers.

## What needs to be done

Add a 20s timer to moments with an animation in the page indicator

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->

TBD

## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/W2xIag64EdbWUlGAQOpVHE/Boost-Update?node-id=755%3A18187&t=0SXJFqBrQKqxdiqo-1)

We will also be putting a 20-second timer on the duration of each moment from now on, both non-boosted and boosted moments. This timer will apply to a progress line above each moment. The normal transition between different users' moments will continue to be used. 

**Start of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs](/uploads/633c82d87ad68fca76ae0a02bfb5c197/Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs.png)

**End of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs](/uploads/608fd706171f00bea46b0616a828ab0e/Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs.png)

## Personas

<!---
Who does this user impact and why (optional)
--->

Moments users

## Experiments

<!---
Experiments are not required, but it should be made clear if one is expected. If experiments are required, the hypothesis should be outlined.
--->


## Acceptance Criteria

* [ ] apply a 20s timer to each moment page
* [ ] long pressing the screen or interacting with the post (comments, share, etc.) should pause the timer
* [ ] the page indicator on top of the moments should fill to show the progress of the timer
* [ ] no progress if the moment timer if it's a video or better mimic the progress with the video progress.

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

title: Mob: Top bar alert component
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

Introduce a horizontal bar like we have used in the past for full-site alerts for the purpose of educating users about the referral and commission program.

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- Create a reusable banner 
- Update text to say "[Refer](https://www.minds.com/settings/other/referrals) sales, fans and creators for cash and token commissions"
- Enable the component to be expandable in the future for other such notices similar to how in-feed notices rotate
- Ensure clicks and dismissals can be tracked

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.

None

--->

- Component should stick to the top of the viewport on scroll until dismissed.
- Clicking the underlined text navigates to a specified URL.
- Clicking the underlined text DOES NOT dismiss.
- Clicking the x button dismisses.
- When a banner is dismissed, it stays dismissed until a new banner message is published.

title: Videos: Full screen button throws an error on consecutive use
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Full screen button throws an error on consecutive use

### Steps to reproduce

1. have 2 consecutive videos on your channel
2. press full screen button on video 1
3. dismiss full screen modal
4. press full screen button on video 2
5. notice the error and that full screen won't work anymore

### Platform information 

tested on iOS, possibly both

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

full screen modal doesn't work

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

full screen modal should always work

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

![image](/uploads/e4588149f5c38ddb485ce4e09cb8071b/image.png)

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

title: Revert boosted content service changes and verify if it works with the fix of the endpoint
description:
## Goal

Now the endpoint is fixed we should test reverting the changes of the boosted content service

Engine:
https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/merge_requests/1269

Mobile: (To be reverted)
https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/2160


## What needs to be done

Revert the changes of https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/merge_requests/2160
- this problem is related to cache and happens in the second run.


## QA

Boost should be injected into the feed

The original problem was with cached Boosts. 
So in order to test this:
 - Open the app and close it after a few seconds 
 - Open the app again, and check that the boosts are injected into the newsfeed and that they render correctly

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Changes reverted
- [ ] Boost should work as expected

## Definition of Ready Checklist

- [ ] Definition Of Done (DoD)
- [ ] Acceptance criteria
- [ ] Weighted
- [ ] QA
- [ ] UX/Design
- [ ] Personas
- [ ] Experiments

Revert

title: IAP: Add FF to potentially hide cash option for GooglePlay users
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

Old title: ~~IAP: Implement Android item payment for boost + dummy API call (optional iOS)~~

## Goal

Provide in-app purchase support to app.

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->


## What needs to be done

~~- Implement Android item payment for Minds Plus~~
~~- Add relevant screens and hooks~~
~~- Add dummy API call for backend~~
~~- (optional) add iOS support~~

Impossible to have a decent technical solution. The current UI would generate 464 unique products with values from $1 to $9000 to be defined in Google Play In-App Purchases.

Repurposed to 
- keep the boost cash option behind a feature flag (default off) - `mob-4836-iap-no-cash`
- prepare an appeal to be sent to Google following their terms violation warning, arguing that there's no decent technical solution to implement boosts with IAP in absence of quantity thus requiring the implementation of at least 454 distinct products, and also the lack of prepaid product since we cannot bill the users after the service would be provided.

@markryansallee, @ottman, @markharding

title: Double click on profile picture, makes profile open twice
description:
### Summary

Double click on profile picture, makes profile open twice

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to your burger menu
2. Doubleclick pfp
3. See that your profile is opened twice (can be seen on video bellow)
4. Notice you don't see suggestions

### Platform information 

Android, 4.32.4

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Double click opens profile twice

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Profile should open once, despite double click

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![XRecorder_11032023_180312](/uploads/6fd573270d329df60e9ee7a823fe1e0a/XRecorder_11032023_180312.mp4)

- investigate how to prevent double tap (optional) maybe a central touchable component.

title: Refactor images using expo-image
description:
## Goal

Refactor all the images of the app from FastImage to expo-image. 

This should improve the performance and memory consumption of the app. expo-image also supports blurhash out of the box and it improves the image caching.


## What needs to be done

- Replace FastImage with expo-image
- Ensure to use the blurhash when available
- Remove custom blurhash implementation

## QA

Smoke test around all the images displayed in the app

## UX/Design

-

title: Mob: Add context to previews of paywalled premium content
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Increase engagement with PREMIUM content from Minds+ subscribers by making the posts more appealing / engaging to users without Minds+ subscriptions.

## What needs to be done

- Update the presentation of Minds+ paywalled content

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

At a high level, changes fall into three categories:

1. Expose text content for media-based posts
2. Add social proof context to paywalled posts (e.g. Bill follows Jack)
3. Reduce blur of images for image-based posts

#### 1.

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/lkwynaYCljUsoeFTqTNJJr/Minds%2B-Paywall?node-id=0%3A1&t=cgizQiiqxEyXdgPW-1)

**Continue Reading Added: Similar use to 'See More' however in this case we use the primary color for the link to serve as a distinguishing factor between the two. Also, when 'Continue reading' is clicked it will open up the Minds+ Modal to subscribe to Minds+ just like the 'Unlock Post' button.**

![1_Continue_reading_added_mob](/uploads/ebd92ad9c12d7fea587550729587bdeb/1_Continue_reading_added_mob.png)

#### 2.

**Addition of 'X' follows 'Y' reusing the remind location. In the case where a Minds+ post is reminded and has this already on the post, the remind would supersede and take priority as the main notice on the post. This is similar to the location we used when we implemented this for Superminds. Icon used in the design is the same as the current 'Groups' material icon**

![2_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added_mob](/uploads/99e2044e08337641a6b67a40cde762c8/2_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added_mob.png)

**'X' and 'Z' follow 'Y'**

![3_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__2_People__mob](/uploads/5bf839e7137d99a9f9f8491d49a04aa4/3_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__2_People__mob.png)

**'X' and 'N others' follow 'Y' where N >= 2**

![4_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__1+N__n___2__mob](/uploads/4248645ad1dc9481cfd30f62d5e6052a/4_Continue_reading_and__X__follows__Y__added__1+N__n___2__mob.png)


| Top Bar Text | Do I follow Mark? | Do I follow Emerson? | Do I follow Jack     |  Do I follow 'X others' | 
| ------------ | ----------------- | -------------------- | -------------------- | ----------------------- |
| Mark follows Emerson | Yes | No | N/A | N/A|
| Mark and Jack follow Emerson| Yes | No | Yes | N/A |
| Mark and 2 others follow Emerson | Yes| No | N/A | Yes |

#### 3.

Reduce blur amount/strength considerably to help give the user more context to unlock the post and join Minds+ to see the full unblurred image.

Equivalent to ~20px blur in CSS.

![5_Reduced_blur_mob](/uploads/cb53dfbd19932f875a527c80f414eb80/5_Reduced_blur_mob.png)

## Mobile

title: Show Keyboard in comments when no comments exists
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Show Keyboard in comments when no comments exists

(Summarize the bug encountered concisely)

### Steps to reproduce

Go on comment on any post with no existing comments. The screen is blank and no keyboard.

(How one can reproduce the issue - this is very important)

### Platform information 

(Browser, device, system stats, screen size)
all

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

When in the comments screen of a post with no comments, the keyboard is not visible.

(What actually happens)

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

When in the comments screen of a post with no comments, the keyboard should be visible so the user can start typing.

(What you should see instead)

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

It should unmount without errors

Remove the removeListener method calls

title: Mobile component (Boost Rotator)
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

<!---
Clearly outline the goal of the issue and why we are doing it
--->

To design a native like mobile component for our in-feed boost rotator. 

## What needs to be done

<!---
Clearly detail what needs to be done to achieve the goal set out above
--->

- To design a mobile version of the in-feed boost rotator, with a carousel / swipe interaction. 
- Note - The carousel wraps around, so the last post will, upon a users' swipe surface the first boosted post in the rotator feed again.
- To ensure some parity between web and mobile, **tapping onto a boosted post will take the user to the specific SEP**, instead of a full screen/moments like carousel.  
- suggestion: use reanimated/snap carousel 
- use suggested height or adjust based on device screen height.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.

title: Add boosts to story swiper
description:
## Goal

Increase Boost impressions.

---

As a Minds, I want to increase Boost inventory supply so that I can better fulfill the demands of customers.

## What needs to be done

Add a Boost slot to the mobile story swiper.

## QA

<!---
Consideration is given to how the issue will be demoed and tested prior to being deployed
--->


## UX/Design

<!---
Sufficient wireframes have been presented and understood by the development team. Full mockups are not required and re-usable components are encouraged.
--->

[Figma](https://www.figma.com/file/W2xIag64EdbWUlGAQOpVHE/Boost-Update?node-id=755%3A18187&t=0SXJFqBrQKqxdiqo-1)

We will be increasing boost inventory space by placing boosted posts in between moments similar to how Instagram does sponsored posts in between stories. 

We will also be putting a 20-second timer on the duration of each moment from now on, both non-boosted and boosted moments. This timer will apply to a progress line above each moment. The normal transition between different user's moments will continue to be used. 

**Start of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs](/uploads/5deda1ec8e909e4763557a60ecfa4cdf/Boosted_Moment_Start_20_Secs.png)

**End of Boosted Moment**

![Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs](/uploads/e34aa2d78f451f8ca7735beee55ff582/Boosted_Moment_End_20_Secs.png)

* [ ] User feedback on usability

description:

title: Camera Not Functioning Correctly Within Post Creation
description:
### Summary On using the "camera" icon within the post creation / "speak your mind" screen, I am presented with a "an error occurred Tab to copy the error" message. ### Platform information Discovered using Minds Mobile Application - Android "unfettered" variant (version 4.32.0 / 4.32.1 (1050000159 / 1050000160)) via Android version 13 (LineageOS version 20-20230221). User: Danzillawhite:minds.com has also reported the same issue within the General:minds.com chat room while using Android version 12 (Samsung One UI version 4.1). ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots The following is the error stack report: ``` undefined is not a function STACK: in wrappedComponent in RCTView in Unknown in PermissionsCheck in RCTView in Unknown in wrappedComponent in StaticContainer in EnsureSingleNavigator in SceneView in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in CardSheet in RCTView in Unknown in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in PanGestureHandler in PanGestureHandler in RCTView in Unknown in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in RCTView in Unknown in Card in CardContainer in RNSScreen in AnimatedComponent in AnimatedComponentWrapper in Suspender in Suspense in Freeze in DelayedFreeze in MaybeFreeze in Screen in MaybeScreen in RNSScreenContainer in ScreenContainer in MaybeScreenContainer in RCTView in Unknown in Background in CardStack in RCTView in Unknown in SafeAreaProviderCompat in RNGestureHandlerRootView in GestureHandlerRootView in StackView in Unknown in StackNavigator in wrappedComponent in WCContextProvider in ErrorBoundary in PortalProviderComponent in BottomSheetModalProviderWrapper in _Theme in _ThemeProvider in _TamaguiProvider in UIProvider in PortalProviderComponent in FriendlyCaptchaProvider in ToastProvider in ThemeProvider in AppMessageProvider in MobXProvider in QueryClientProvider in QueryProvider in StoresProvider in EnsureSingleNavigator in BaseNavigationContainer in ThemeProvider in NavigationContainerInner in RNCSafeAreaProvider in SafeAreaProvider in GrowthBookProvider in ExperimentsProvider in RCTView in Unknown in App in RCTView in Unknown in RCTView in Unknown in AppContainer ``` Reference: * Danzillawhite:minds.com's General Chat Room Based Report (20230223T23:37Z)

title: Add CPM to Boost console for completed Boosts
description:
<!---
Please read this!

The Definition of Ready (DoR) can be found at https://developers.minds.com/docs/handbook/how-we-work/#definition-of-ready-dor

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "Type::Feature" label and verify the feature you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

## Goal

Help customers understand the ROI of their Boosts by displaying the CPM (cost per thousand views) of a completed Boost.

## What needs to be done

Add the calculated CPM to the Boost console view of _completed_ Boosts.

A CPM result could look something like...

- $3.00
- 5 tokens

Include a tooltip (on hover) with the following copy:

> CPM is the cost per 1,000 views (cost per mille)

## QA

Deleting a pose causes double errors

Create a post from Home.
Delete a post.
Click ok on the delete confirmation
You'll get a "Sorry, it looks like there was an error."
Then you'll "Success, Entity removed successfull" 

- [ ] Make sure the post gets deleted successfully

- [ ] Remove the "Success!" message and just update the feed view so the entity gets removed

title: Use a remote action for my channel save
Compose should be default mobile screen
description:
When the user opens the app from a cold state, open compose by default


When the user swipes left from compose, go to discovery screen
When the user swipes left from home screen, compose
When the user swipes left from discovery, open home
 
When the user swipes right from compose, go to the home screen
When the user swipes right from home, go to the discovery screen
When the user swipes right from discovery, open compose

@ottman @jotto141 Added a proposal some basic swipe cyclical nav to the screens above. The app opens to compose by default and the those three screens provide swipe navigation, following snap chats basic feel.

Switching between light mode and dark mode should display the same state on the groups bar.

title: Cannot vote on blogs from discovery
description:
![Screenshot_20200308-122807_Minds](/uploads/7f4b6e490fb422a892ed3e366371b4fc/Screenshot_20200308-122807_Minds.jpg)

I cannot verify this. When I vote on a blog in discovery, it works.

Note, @ottman has really weak signal strength in this screen shot.

Let's make this a bigger card to improve our bad connectivity error handling.
https://www.natashatherobot.com/simulate-bad-network-ios-simulator/

With bad network, make sure we're handling errors
- [ ] Make sure we're handling timeout errors with a "Poor network connection. Please, try again later."

title: Remind errors but reminds anyway
description:
This is very confusing to user because when you go to a channel From a reminded post on your channel and then try to remind one of their new posts it shoots an error but still posts to your feed ![Screenshot_20200306-205353_Minds](/uploads/0f24663850e65f8965e290dea7d532cc/Screenshot_20200306-205353_Minds.jpg)

I was able to remind successfully without error from a reminded channel, but we need to make sure that we're handling errors coming out of reminds when we have bad network connectivity.

title: Cannot edit post
description:
![Screenshot_20200306-204422_Minds](/uploads/880bd2ba83701a19c922b24879781fc4/Screenshot_20200306-204422_Minds.jpg)

Was this tested?

I am able to edit a post @ottman. We'll verify that we can edit the post and add some graceful error handling around bad network connectivity.

- [ ] Make sure we can edit a post
- [ ] Make sure have a "Poor connection. Please, try again later" error handling for bad connectivity.

title: Issues with the 4.0.0 RC 1 Test Release
description:
List of quick changes from the team's QA review. Bigger issues in separate and linked cards

- [x] get rid of Home text on top of newsfeed and put a minds icon (centered)

- [x] fix white lines between posts in dark mode should be way darker

- [x] should be able to access subscription lists directly from nav screen. Make the subscribers count on the main nav screen a link that will take them to the same page as if they went under their channel and clicked their subscriber list.

- [x] help and support and refer friends should not be on top of nav not. those should be in settings

- [x] wallet icon wrong

- [x] boost icon and wallet icon are backwards

- [x] ditch square green buttons they look out of place. All buttons should be replaced with blue text hyperlinks on light mode. Need to confirm the text button color for dark mode. Confirming with Michael

- [x] logout should only be in settings and should be at bottom of list

- [x] text cut off in push notifications settings on top

- [X] log only errors setting means nothing to anyone (this is getting fixed in the new designs and moved to a developer tools panel in the new settings, nothing to fix here)

- [x] remove the left handed mode activity entirely

- [x] dark mode switcher should really move to the main nav screen in the bottom (in the menu)

- [x] there's a gray background behind the filters on my channel in light mode that shouldn't be there

- [x] the lines between notifications in light mode are way too dark

- [x]  the gallery, photo and video buttons in soon to be legacy composer should not be gray background

- [x] the buttons in blocked channels have the same square button issue. the post button in the composer with the oval make more sense for now until we bring in the new designs everywhere

- [X] be able to swipe out of the nav screen and leave a bit of open space on the far right side. Moving this one to a separate card so we can setup nav properly

- [x] Reply count skewed

title: Minor theme color fixes in components
description:

* [x]  Small improvement in navigator

description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

I get an error message every time. See screenshot below.

NOTE: The account I used for this test is @ JakePassi.

NOTE: Canary mode is turned on.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Log out.
2. Press "Forgot Password?"
3. Enter your username.
4. Press "CONTINUE".
5. Press the link in the email.
6. Enter a new password which meets the requirements.
7. Re-enter the password.
8. Press "CONTINUE"

### Platform information

iPhone SE / iOS 12.1.4

### App version

iOS app (Version 3.3.0)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Password reset doesn't work in the iOS app.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Password reset should work in the iOS app.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: (bug): Pressing the globe icon at the bottom of a blog navigates the user to the previous page
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

NOTE: The account I used for this test is @ JakePassi.

NOTE: Canary mode is turned on.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to one of your own blogs.
2. Press the globe icon at the bottom.

### Platform information

iPhone SE / iOS 12.1.4

### App version

iOS app (Version 3.3.0)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Pressing the globe icon at the bottom of a blog navigates the user to the previous page in the iOS app.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Pressing the globe icon at the bottom of a blog should allow the user to translate the blog into another language. Unless it's the license icon. If so, then pressing it shouldn't do anything and should say which license is attached to the blog.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

description:
<!---

filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

Users can still post more than 5 hashtags on mobile, not matching the front-site. Note this needs to be done for edit too - else a user can bypass it altogether, just adding tags in after. Ideally an error should be shown.

### Steps to reproduce
Add:
* Create a post with more than 5 hashtags
* Save it and see

Edit:
* Create a post with 5 hashtags
* Edit it
* Add another hashtag
* Save 

### Platform information 

iOS and Android 

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The user can have more than 5 hashtags on a post

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The user should NOT be allowed to add a post with, or edit a post so that there are more than 5 hashtags, ideally an error should show to indicate why the user cannot post.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

description:
@gthouret has indentified as dead code.

@msantang78 can you verify that this code is no longer being used and clean it up.


Boost API Usage

| Boost API | Platform | File Reference | Comment
| ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ |
| `api/v1/boost/fetch/newsfeed` | Mobile | `src/newsfeed/NewsfeedService.js` | `NewsfeedService.getBoosts()` function, queries with `limit \|\| ''`, `offset \|\| ''`, `rating \|\| 1`, `platform= ios \|\| other` Used by `NewsFeedStore.loadBoosts()` and `NewsFeedStore.loadFeed()` |
| `api/v2/boost/feed` | Mobile | `src/common/services/boosted-content.service.js` | `BoostedContentService.load()` function, queries with `limit=12`, `offset=0` Seems to be a basic service for fetching boosts using `FeedsService`.  Can't find any usage within mobile app?!?  I think this is code copied over from the Web app |

Still need to dive into the code here to provide more details but it seems that these strings aren't part of the mobile app or aren't associated with these notification types.

title: Match paywall language with web app
description:
We should be saying the same text on paywalls on both mobile and web. Here is what we currently have.

## Minds+ Paywall

title: Tapping comment notifications results in losing description on post
description:
When you tap a notification for a vote or remind, it correctly displays the post title and description.

When you tap a notification for a comment, it only displays the title with no description.



See video explanation:


![RPReplay_Final1595276472](/uploads/071d8640ce4bf071bb177a75940f9097/RPReplay_Final1595276472.MP4)

title: Update Minds+ Discovery organization to be consistent with regular discovery
description:
Minds+ Discovery should be consistent with regular discovery.

The sections should be:

1. Just for you

This section should be all of the top Minds+ content using same backend as web app. All of the content should be visible and when a non Minds+ member tries to click it, they should be prompted to upgrade.

2. Your tags

This section should just be the users saved tags, same as it is on regular discovery. However, if they are in the context of Minds+, it should only show Minds+ content in the hashtag feed. Under your saved tags, we should be presenting the Suggested hashtag list.

3. Trending

This section should be all of the trending hashtags specifically for Minds+ content. We likely do not have data for this right now, so we can probably hide it until there is real data. @markeharding

title: Hashtags are getting applied to consecutive posts
description:
Steps to replicate:

1. Open composer
2. Make status post
3. Add #art
4. Post it
5. Open composer again
6. Go to make status post again
7. Notice that #art is automatically assigned to the new post. This should be blank for a new post.

title: Never show no results in discovery "For You" section
description:
## Regular Discovery

If a user visits regular Discovery and has no saved tags, copy web logic (screenshot).

![Screen_Shot_2020-07-20_at_1.18.32_PM](/uploads/55f858cac24cdfbfd23e24cadc648481/Screen_Shot_2020-07-20_at_1.18.32_PM.png)

## Minds+ Discovery

If a user visits Minds+ Discovery, they should see all of the top Minds+ content as if they are in Minds+, but whenever they attempt to open the content, we should prompt then to Upgrade to Minds+.

Currently there is another bug where Minds+ discovery is pulling regular content upon refresh. See https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2417

title: Search memory enhancement
description:
Expand the search dropdown which appears upon first click to include channels you have selected from the autocomplete feature.

The autocomplete feature displays channels in the same dropdown region once you start typing based on the characters you are typing.

Currently the only memory that exists within the search dropdown is from full searches (meaning you actually pressed enter). This task calls for remembering BOTH full search queries and selected autocomplete suggestions.

title: Require hashtags for plus submissions
Make the bottom options background opaque and move the camera on top
Portrait Content Feed
description:
## Tasks

- [x] Create a local store to remember videos that have been seen (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2518)
- [x] Send `GET` request to return a list of all portrait videos (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1690)
- [x] Filter out videos that have been seen locally (https://gitlab.com/minds/mobile-native/-/issues/2518)
- [x] Submit is_portrait of object:video and activity to elasticsearch (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1689)
- [x] Ability to filter feed by portrait on the backend (https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/-/issues/1690)
- [x] Implement a portrait bar component that shows available content
- [x] Implement a portrait content swiper

## Overview

The portrait feed is being used as a means to encourage native content (video and images) via the mobile apps. In essence, this implementation is a ‘pseudo-stories implementation’.

Framer Prototype
https://framer.com/share/Portrait-Feed-9BQBZfHLa1fjnokJKiiV

Design Assets
[Spec Export - Sketch Measure 2.4](https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%23-portrait-feed/#artboard1)

Some functionality may be open to change.

## Functionality
* If a user uploads a portrait image or video from the mobile app, it will feature in the portrait content feed, as well as the normal newsfeed.
* The user contributes via the normal composer.
* When a user views a portrait piece of content, it is marked as seen.
* Unseen content will be highlighted within the feed with a yellow stroke
* Portrait content is displayed within the same UI as the full screen swiper, with in the inclusion of a ‘stepper’ at the top of the image/video.
* Tapping on a channel within the feed will bring the user to the first unseen post belonging to that user.
* The user can access the next post by tapping on the right of the screen
* The user can access the previous post by tapping on the left of the screen.
* Posts are grouped by channel.
* Swiping from right - left will bring the user to the next channel (to the first unseen post).
* Swiping from left-right will bring the user to the previous channel
* Tapping the `+` icons the left of the channel icons will engage the composer
* Only content created within the last 48hrs will be displayed within the portrait content feed.
* When the composer is engaged, the gallery functionality should be removed. The text option from the bottom of the composer should also be removed.


cc @ottman @ottman - you may want to run your eyes over the above points. In particular the 'TBC' items.

title: Editing post from channel or full screen view deletes the post
description:
If you edit a post on mobile, it deletes the post. Nasty bug.

Steps to replicate:

1. Make a status post on mobile
2. Go to your channel
3. Click to edit the post
4. Make an edit and click Save.
5. You briefly see edited post and it says 50 years ago. Scroll to refresh channel feed. Status post disappears

title: Post titles are not showing up in mobile app
description:
Post titles are not showing up anywhere on mobile app.

To replicate:

View this post on web with a title:

https://www.minds.com/newsfeed/1122266873826193408

Then go to Jack channel on mobile and look at the same post. The title does not show.

Mobile 4.2 iphone 7

title: Cannot view long status posts inside of composer
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "T - Bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

If you are typing a longer status post, once the text gets past the bottom of the composer window, there is no way to see what you are typing any more. It goes below the screen and there is no scroll activated.

### Steps to reproduce

1. open composer on mobile
2. go to text input
3. type in very long status

### Platform information 

iphone 4.2.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

see summary

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

scroll should be activated so you can see entire status

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

(Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output,
logs, and code as it's very hard to read otherwise.)

### Possible fixes

(If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem)

Fully implement flow static analysis for react native
description:
Now that flow has better support for Typescript, we need to update our mobile-native configuration to do static analysis at the CI level and catch any type errors / null

- [X] Upgrade our type script typing and make sure we've got our stack up to date.
- [X] Make the app compile with type script
- [X] Add static analysis checking to the CI flow
- [X] Make sure the app builds and deploys
- [ ] Roll out complete type checking so we can catch all the errors
- [ ] Enable Prettier at the CI level

title: Add retry logic to images
description:
Implement a retry logic for images with delay. This will reduce the "Error loading media" with intermittent connectivity.

Also, if all the retries fail, we can hook the component to the connectivity service to try to reload the images when the connectivity status change

![image](/uploads/b60ed97bbfe7e321b243c440062eea64/image.png)

![image](/uploads/8ae5253163fe2f3ac1ff4fd84970fc36/image.png)

title: Handle expired email verification links
description:
### Design links

* Normal verification sheet - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/rb57mrE/r/Dnmbnk
* Verified state - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/oY5wEr0
* Link expired state - https://www.sketch.com/s/1f4ae3ad-52df-407e-a74d-1a37bc8d0319/a/m1WYnGw

From @benhayward.ben 

When a user follows an invalid email verification link, display an error

- [ ] Display a "Your verification request has expired." error but do not trigger a resend. We don't want to create a loop caused by people clicking on the back end. Better to capture this process asynchronoysly and make sure we redisplay the verification when they resend


Based off feedback in thread: https://gitlab.com/minds/front/merge_requests/699#note_263718217

title: Give old users option to do new onboarding
description:
- [ ] Create a "Setup your account" link on the channel screen (on the existing screen for channels)
- [ ] Setup a "Finish setting up your account" that displays if the user has not completed onboarding that displays after the "verify your email" banner
- [ ] For old users, who have not completed onboarding, display the banner.
- [ ] Setup an "onboarding-reminder" feature flag so we can roll this out to specific users.

@ottman @markeharding , rolling this out. Please, review the messaging and give feedback for the simplest version of being able to re-onboard I could come up with (mobile version)

- [x] disable the e2e tests that check for groups and onboarding

New Posts have a scheduled time of now bar
description:
### Summary

When you create a new image or video post. It will have a schedule release time of the current time when posted. 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Make an image or video post

### Platform information

Android

### App version

3.15.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

New Posts have scheduled time now banner

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Posts that aren't scheduled should not have a scheduled time bar on them.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

title: Date picker for onboarding needs to not send a date unless they choose one
description:
During onboarding, the date picker defaults to today and sends the dob to the channel endpoint

Set a private field that gets cleared when the date is changed

Only send the dob if they change it

title: Onboarding 3.15.0 Clean up

Engine is now the source of truth for mobile.

We need to go through our flags and remove the logic and functionality for any ones not defined in engine

title: Align login input icon both platforms
Compose post actions bottom bar
description:
Implement the post actions bottom bar


Clicking on the post options button should slide up a panel that allows for advanced configuration
### Options
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard9
- [ ] Tagging
- [ ] NSFW
- [ ] Scheduling post
- [ ] Monetize
- [ ] Visibility
- [ ] License

title: Compose top bar
description:
Implement the meatball menu on the top right on the new composer modal

Owners and admins should be able to toggle the option. 

Non owners and non admins should see the menus as read only with what is currently selected. They should see the top level text "Visibility" and "License" replaced with the currently selected option

Owner/admin needs to be able to toggle licensing just like on the current blogs editor. 

Owner/admin needs to be able to toggle visibility like the old media viewer


### License screen
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard17

### Visibility 
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard18



- [ ] Clicking the meatball menu should display the toolbar
- [ ] Bring over the existing meatball menu so we can have existing functionality
- [ ] Put the two new toggles on the top
- [ ] Admins and owners should be able to interact with the meatball menu
- [ ] None owners should only see read only information
- [ ] light mode
- [ ] dark mode
- [ ] unit tests
- [ ] e2e tests
- [ ] responsive design
- [ ] point MR 3.16.0 branch

title: The plus button on the new nav bar should open the new capture screen
description:
On the new nav ui, the plus button needs to open a new composer component that can switch between video, camera and text

### Video capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard1

### Image capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard2

### Text capture
https://design.minds.com/hosted/mobile/michael/mobile%231687-composer/#artboard5

- [ ] setup a new feature flag called "compose" and make it unleash-able
- [ ] Default to the video capture and enable the local device video capture
- [ ] Allow switching between the video, image and text modes
- [ ] Light mode
- [ ] dark mode
- [ ] behind a "compose" feature flag that responds to the new unleash changes on the backend
- [ ] unit tests
- [ ] e2e tests

title: Clean up styles for light mode and dark mode
description:
To enable the styles for light mode and dark mode, we need to unify our styles and clean them up into themes

- [ ] Don't change the old screens, we're only rolling light and dark mode for the rewrite
- [ ] Make sure we have themes for nav, composer and onboarding
- [ ] clean up our styles into light mode and dark mode themes

Remove register animation
Remove login/register FF conditionals and code cleanup

description:
### Summary

Onle landing page is still accessible

### Steps to reproduce

From login
1. Join Minds Now
2. Click back button
3. See old landing page
4. fill out information to register a new channel
5. go to new registration to fill out information again

### Platform information

Android

### App version

3.15.0

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Can navigate to old landing page

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Old landing page should auto redirect to new login.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![old_landing](/uploads/45a8e1f59b826b88df5b908d6464ed1e/old_landing.mp4)

title: Hardware back button should send us to previous onboarding step
description:
When doing onboarding, on android, the backbutton should send us to previous step.

This task comes from #1732

title: Document unleash client functionality on the repository and launch our Beta
description:
We need to have full usage instructions on how to use our unleash client. This should be as community facing as possible, so we can send it over to Unleash and get the accolades we deserve.

- [ ] Add a status badge to show the state of our tests
- [ ] Make sure master is protected and we can only push in via MRs
- [ ] Document environment variables and configuration
- [ ] Installation instructions
- [ ] Document using our strategies
- [ ] Document Gitlab integration
- [ ] Publish our vendor package

When this is done, I'll send it over to the unleash maintainers for linking and feedback

(29 additional frame(s) were not displayed)

title: Upgrade sentry on Mobile
description: There's been active development on sentry.io. We need to upgrade our mobile-native package to get all the latest and greatest

title: Simplify and audit our feature flags
description:
We're rolling out our new unleash feature flag service

For mobile that consumes that talks to the FF api and ships with a config file not much is going to change. The export and the service will return what flags are white listed in https://gitlab.com/minds/engine/issues/1318

For the ongoing rewrite, we need to combine the various onboarding, nav and product pages into one new-design flag

* [ ] make sure the feature flags defaults defined in the app are up to date
* [ ] combine new design flags into new-design
* [ ] audit feature flags on app. Remove any that are no longer in use
* [ ] make sure app responds to turning the feature flags on and off via gitlab's unleash api

title: Implement dark mode / light mode switcher
description:
- [ ] Add a button to the settings menu to switch between light mode and dark mode
- [ ] Have the setting persist locally so when a user logs in, they will have their selected mode
- [ ] Make sure switching is performant
- [ ] Should be behind a ```dark-mode``` feature flag controllable by unleash
@msantang78, @juanmsolaro set up the dark mode styles for the app. We can turn them on with a switch. This card is for adding the user toggle and making sure that we won't have performance problems with switching themes in mobx

title: Add date range to the feed filter
description:

The channel's feeds date range filter is missing on mobile

The feed filter on mobile currently have the following options

![Screen_Shot_2021-11-30_at_14.35.10](/uploads/c0a4caf42569c596aa7e1c251f318485/Screen_Shot_2021-11-30_at_14.35.10.png)

@michaelfbradley We need to add the date range filter into the options

FYI: I implemented a date picket with the bottom sheet too, so from a developer perspective, it would be simpler to implement something similar to what the web has. Show the `from` and `to` dates, and open the calendar when the user taps on one of them

title: Add NSFW option to search filter
description:
### Summary

Add NSFW filter to the discovery filters, it must be active only for Android full version

title: Investigate/Test moving all navigation the a native stack
description:
### Summary

Investigate the feasibility of using only the native stack navigator for the entire application

Currently, we have the main stack in the native navigator but we have a main JS navigator in order to be able to implement the transparent modals

Moving all to native will improve the performance of the transitions and it will allow us to move everything into a single stack

title: [GAT-MDS-1-109] Error "Sorry, it looks like there was an error" appear when user follow other user
description:

Newsfeed

Steps to reproduce:
Launch App
Reach Newsfeed
Tap on 3 dot menu from any post
Tap on Follow menu
Observe that Error Error "Sorry, it looks like there was an error" appear

Severity:
